+ /* ========================================

+    Modern, Tech-focused Design

+ :root {

+ æœ€ã‚‚ç°¡å˜ãªçµ±åˆæ–¹æ³•ã€‚StripeãŒãƒ›ã‚¹ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ã‚¦ãƒˆãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã€‚

+ #### ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰ (Rust + axum)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // Cargo.toml
+ [dependencies]
+ stripe = &quot;0.26&quot;
+ axum = &quot;0.7&quot;
+ tokio = { version = &quot;1&quot;, features = [&quot;full&quot;] }
+ serde = { version = &quot;1&quot;, features = [&quot;derive&quot;] }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ use stripe::{
+     Client, CheckoutSession, CheckoutSessionMode,
+     CreateCheckoutSession, CreateCheckoutSessionLineItems,
+ };
+ use axum::{
+     extract::Json,
+     response::{IntoResponse, Redirect},
+     Router, routing::post,
+ };
+ 
+ #[derive(serde::Deserialize)]
+ struct CreateCheckoutRequest {
+     price_id: String,
+     customer_email: String,
+ }
+ 
+ async fn create_checkout_session(
+     Json(req): Json&lt;CreateCheckoutRequest&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let client = Client::new(std::env::var(&quot;STRIPE_SECRET_KEY&quot;).unwrap());
+     
+     let mut params = CreateCheckoutSession::new();
+     params.mode = Some(CheckoutSessionMode::Subscription);
+     params.customer_email = Some(&amp;req.customer_email);
+     params.line_items = Some(vec![CreateCheckoutSessionLineItems {
+         price: Some(req.price_id),
+         quantity: Some(1),
+         ..Default::default()
+     }]);
+     params.success_url = Some(&quot;https://codex.ai/success?session_id={CHECKOUT_SESSION_ID}&quot;);
+     params.cancel_url = Some(&quot;https://codex.ai/pricing&quot;);
+     
+     match CheckoutSession::create(&amp;client, params).await {
+         Ok(session) =&gt; {
+             // Return checkout URL to client
+             Json(serde_json::json!({
+                 &quot;checkout_url&quot;: session.url
+             })).into_response()
+         }
+         Err(e) =&gt; {
+             eprintln!(&quot;Stripe error: {}&quot;, e);
+             (axum::http::StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, &quot;Error&quot;).into_response()
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[tokio::main]
+ async fn main() {
+     let app = Router::new()
+         .route(&quot;/create-checkout-session&quot;, post(create_checkout_session));
+     
+     let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind(&quot;0.0.0.0:3000&quot;).await.unwrap();
+     axum::serve(listener, app).await.unwrap();
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+

+ ### 5.1 Webhookã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆä½œæˆ
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ use stripe::{Event, EventObject, EventType};
+ use axum::{
+     body::Bytes,
+     extract::State,
+     http::{HeaderMap, StatusCode},
+     routing::post,
+     Router,
+ };
+ 
+ async fn stripe_webhook(
+     State(webhook_secret): State&lt;String&gt;,
+     headers: HeaderMap,
+     body: Bytes,
+ ) -&gt; StatusCode {
+     let payload = std::str::from_utf8(&amp;body).unwrap();
+     let signature = headers
+         .get(&quot;stripe-signature&quot;)
+         .and_then(|v| v.to_str().ok())
+         .unwrap_or(&quot;&quot;);
+     
+     match stripe::Webhook::construct_event(payload, signature, &amp;webhook_secret) {
+         Ok(event) =&gt; {
+             match event.type_ {
+                 EventType::CheckoutSessionCompleted =&gt; {
+                     // Handle successful checkout
+                     println!(&quot;âœ… Checkout completed!&quot;);
+                     // 1. Create user account
+                     // 2. Send welcome email
+                     // 3. Grant access to Pro features
+                 }
+                 EventType::CustomerSubscriptionCreated =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;âœ… Subscription created!&quot;);
+                 }
+                 EventType::CustomerSubscriptionUpdated =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;ğŸ”„ Subscription updated!&quot;);
+                 }
+                 EventType::CustomerSubscriptionDeleted =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;âŒ Subscription canceled!&quot;);
+                     // Revoke access
+                 }
+                 EventType::InvoicePaymentSucceeded =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;ğŸ’° Payment succeeded!&quot;);
+                 }
+                 EventType::InvoicePaymentFailed =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;âŒ Payment failed!&quot;);
+                     // Send payment retry email
+                 }
+                 _ =&gt; {
+                     println!(&quot;Unhandled event type: {:?}&quot;, event.type_);
+                 }
+             }
+             StatusCode::OK
+         }
+         Err(e) =&gt; {
+             eprintln!(&quot;Webhook error: {}&quot;, e);
+             StatusCode::BAD_REQUEST
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;mermaid

+

+ Real-time task progress updates
+ 
+ ### Connection
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;javascript
+ const ws = new WebSocket(&#39;wss://api.codex.ai/v1/agents/tasks/task_1ABC2DEF3GHI/stream?token=&lt;access_token&gt;&#39;);
+ 
+ ws.onopen = () =&gt; {
+   console.log(&#39;Connected&#39;);
+ };
+ 
+ ws.onmessage = (event) =&gt; {
+   const data = JSON.parse(event.data);
+   console.log(&#39;Progress:&#39;, data);
+ };
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Message Format
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;json
+ // Progress update
+ {
+   &quot;type&quot;: &quot;progress&quot;,
+   &quot;task_id&quot;: &quot;task_1ABC2DEF3GHI&quot;,
+   &quot;progress&quot;: 45,
+   &quot;message&quot;: &quot;Analyzing code...&quot;,
+   &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;2025-11-02T10:00:25Z&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ // Result
+ {
+   &quot;type&quot;: &quot;result&quot;,
+   &quot;task_id&quot;: &quot;task_1ABC2DEF3GHI&quot;,
+   &quot;status&quot;: &quot;completed&quot;,
+   &quot;result&quot;: {...},
+   &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;2025-11-02T10:00:50Z&quot;
+ }
+ 
+ // Error
+ {
+   &quot;type&quot;: &quot;error&quot;,
+   &quot;task_id&quot;: &quot;task_1ABC2DEF3GHI&quot;,
+   &quot;error&quot;: {
+     &quot;code&quot;: &quot;AGENT_TIMEOUT&quot;,
+     &quot;message&quot;: &quot;Task exceeded maximum duration&quot;
+   },
+   &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;2025-11-02T10:05:00Z&quot;
+ }
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+

+ ## &lt;a name=&quot;rate-limiting&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;â±ï¸ Rate Limiting
+ 
+ ### Limits by Tier
+ 
+ | Tier | Requests/month | Requests/minute | Parallel agents | Storage |
+ |------|---------------|-----------------|-----------------|---------|
+ | Free | 100 | 5 | 1 | 1GB |
+ | Pro | 10,000 | 100 | 10 | 10GB |
+ | Team | 100,000 | 1,000 | 50 | 100GB |
+ | Enterprise | Unlimited | Custom | Unlimited | Custom |
+ 
+ ### Headers
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ X-RateLimit-Limit: 100
+ X-RateLimit-Remaining: 95
+ X-RateLimit-Reset: 1699999999
+ X-RateLimit-Tier: pro

+

+     &quot;tier&quot;: &quot;pro&quot;,

+ }

+ -- Prism Database Schema
+ -- Supabase PostgreSQL
+ -- Version: 1.0.0
+ -- Updated: 2025-11-02
+ 
+ -- Enable UUID extension
+ CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS &quot;uuid-ossp&quot;;
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 1. Profiles (User metadata)
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE profiles (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES auth.users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   email TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
+   display_name TEXT,
+   avatar_url TEXT,
+   github_username TEXT,
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
+ );
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies for profiles
+ ALTER TABLE profiles ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can view own profile&quot;
+   ON profiles FOR SELECT
+   USING (auth.uid() = id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can update own profile&quot;
+   ON profiles FOR UPDATE
+   USING (auth.uid() = id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can insert own profile&quot;
+   ON profiles FOR INSERT
+   WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = id);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 2. User API Keys (Encrypted)
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE user_api_keys (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   provider TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (provider IN (&#39;openai&#39;, &#39;anthropic&#39;)),
+   encrypted_key TEXT NOT NULL,
+   key_name TEXT, -- User-defined name for the key
+   is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
+   last_used_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   UNIQUE(user_id, provider, key_name)
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_user_api_keys_user_provider ON user_api_keys(user_id, provider);
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE user_api_keys ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can manage own API keys&quot;
+   ON user_api_keys FOR ALL
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 3. Repositories
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE repositories (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   repo_url TEXT NOT NULL,
+   repo_name TEXT NOT NULL,
+   repo_owner TEXT, -- GitHub username/org
+   default_branch TEXT DEFAULT &#39;main&#39;,
+   last_analyzed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
+   total_commits INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   total_files INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   total_lines INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   primary_language TEXT,
+   languages JSONB, -- {&quot;Rust&quot;: 65.4, &quot;TypeScript&quot;: 25.2, ...}
+   storage_path TEXT, -- Supabase Storage path
+   is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   UNIQUE(user_id, repo_url)
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_repositories_user ON repositories(user_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_repositories_public ON repositories(is_public) WHERE is_public = true;
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE repositories ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can manage own repositories&quot;
+   ON repositories FOR ALL
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Anyone can view public repositories&quot;
+   ON repositories FOR SELECT
+   USING (is_public = true);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 4. Visualizations
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE visualizations (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   repository_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES repositories(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   title TEXT,
+   description TEXT,
+   visualization_type TEXT DEFAULT &#39;3d&#39; CHECK (visualization_type IN (&#39;3d&#39;, &#39;4d&#39;, &#39;heatmap&#39;, &#39;network&#39;)),
+   
+   -- Metadata (stored in DB)
+   metadata JSONB, -- {total_commits, date_range, etc}
+   
+   -- Large data (stored in Supabase Storage)
+   data_storage_path TEXT, -- nodes, edges, timeline data
+   
+   -- Sharing
+   share_token TEXT UNIQUE DEFAULT encode(gen_random_bytes(16), &#39;hex&#39;),
+   is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
+   share_expires_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
+   
+   -- Stats
+   view_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_visualizations_repo ON visualizations(repository_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_visualizations_user ON visualizations(user_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_visualizations_share_token ON visualizations(share_token);
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE visualizations ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can manage own visualizations&quot;
+   ON visualizations FOR ALL
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Anyone can view public visualizations&quot;
+   ON visualizations FOR SELECT
+   USING (is_public = true);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Anyone with share token can view&quot;
+   ON visualizations FOR SELECT
+   USING (
+     share_token IS NOT NULL AND
+     (share_expires_at IS NULL OR share_expires_at &gt; NOW())
+   );
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 5. AI Sessions (Chat history)
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE ai_sessions (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   repository_id UUID REFERENCES repositories(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
+   
+   -- AI Provider info
+   provider TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (provider IN (&#39;openai&#39;, &#39;anthropic&#39;)),
+   model TEXT NOT NULL,
+   
+   -- Conversation
+   title TEXT,
+   messages JSONB NOT NULL DEFAULT &#39;[]&#39;::jsonb, -- [{role, content, timestamp}]
+   
+   -- Metrics
+   total_tokens INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   total_messages INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
+   
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_ai_sessions_user ON ai_sessions(user_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_ai_sessions_repo ON ai_sessions(repository_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_ai_sessions_created ON ai_sessions(created_at DESC);
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE ai_sessions ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can manage own sessions&quot;
+   ON ai_sessions FOR ALL
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 6. Usage Stats (å°†æ¥ã®èª²é‡‘ç”¨)
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE usage_stats (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   
+   -- Provider &amp; Model
+   provider TEXT NOT NULL,
+   model TEXT NOT NULL,
+   
+   -- Usage metrics
+   tokens_used INTEGER NOT NULL,
+   request_count INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
+   
+   -- Cost tracking (for future billing)
+   estimated_cost_usd DECIMAL(10, 6),
+   
+   -- Timestamps
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   period_start DATE GENERATED ALWAYS AS (DATE(created_at)) STORED
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_usage_stats_user_period ON usage_stats(user_id, period_start);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_usage_stats_provider ON usage_stats(provider, model);
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE usage_stats ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can view own usage stats&quot;
+   ON usage_stats FOR SELECT
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;System can insert usage stats&quot;
+   ON usage_stats FOR INSERT
+   WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 7. Comments (Collaboration)
+ -- ========================================
+ CREATE TABLE comments (
+   id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
+   visualization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES visualizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES profiles(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
+   commit_sha TEXT NOT NULL,
+   content TEXT NOT NULL,
+   
+   -- Metadata
+   position JSONB, -- {x, y, z} for 3D position
+   
+   created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
+   updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
+ );
+ 
+ CREATE INDEX idx_comments_visualization ON comments(visualization_id);
+ CREATE INDEX idx_comments_commit ON comments(commit_sha);
+ 
+ -- RLS Policies
+ ALTER TABLE comments ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can create comments&quot;
+   ON comments FOR INSERT
+   WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can update own comments&quot;
+   ON comments FOR UPDATE
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Users can delete own comments&quot;
+   ON comments FOR DELETE
+   USING (auth.uid() = user_id);
+ 
+ CREATE POLICY &quot;Anyone can view comments on public visualizations&quot;
+   ON comments FOR SELECT
+   USING (
+     EXISTS (
+       SELECT 1 FROM visualizations v
+       WHERE v.id = comments.visualization_id
+       AND (v.is_public = true OR v.user_id = auth.uid())
+     )
+   );
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 8. Functions
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- Update updated_at timestamp
+ CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column()
+ RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
+ BEGIN
+   NEW.updated_at = NOW();
+   RETURN NEW;
+ END;
+ $$ language &#39;plpgsql&#39;;
+ 
+ -- Apply to all tables
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_profiles_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON profiles
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_user_api_keys_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON user_api_keys
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_repositories_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON repositories
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_visualizations_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON visualizations
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_ai_sessions_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON ai_sessions
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ CREATE TRIGGER update_comments_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON comments
+   FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 9. Views (ä¾¿åˆ©ãªã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒª)
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- User usage summary
+ CREATE VIEW user_usage_summary AS
+ SELECT 
+   user_id,
+   DATE_TRUNC(&#39;month&#39;, created_at) as month,
+   provider,
+   SUM(tokens_used) as total_tokens,
+   SUM(request_count) as total_requests,
+   SUM(estimated_cost_usd) as total_cost
+ FROM usage_stats
+ GROUP BY user_id, DATE_TRUNC(&#39;month&#39;, created_at), provider;
+ 
+ -- Repository statistics
+ CREATE VIEW repository_stats AS
+ SELECT 
+   r.id,
+   r.repo_name,
+   r.user_id,
+   r.total_commits,
+   COUNT(DISTINCT v.id) as visualization_count,
+   SUM(v.view_count) as total_views,
+   MAX(v.created_at) as last_visualization_at
+ FROM repositories r
+ LEFT JOIN visualizations v ON v.repository_id = r.id
+ GROUP BY r.id, r.repo_name, r.user_id, r.total_commits;
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 10. Initial Data (Optional)
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- Example: Create system user for demos
+ -- INSERT INTO auth.users (id, email) VALUES 
+ --   (&#39;00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000&#39;, &#39;demo@prism.dev&#39;);
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 11. Storage Policies
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- Note: Storage policies are set via Supabase Dashboard
+ -- Buckets to create:
+ -- 1. visualizations (public read)
+ -- 2. avatars (public read)
+ -- 3. artifacts (private)
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- 12. Realtime Publication (Optional)
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- Enable realtime for specific tables
+ ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE visualizations;
+ ALTER PUBLICATION supabase_realtime ADD TABLE comments;
+ 
+ -- ========================================
+ -- END OF SCHEMA
+ -- ========================================
+ 
+ -- Apply this schema in Supabase:
+ -- 1. Dashboard â†’ SQL Editor
+ -- 2. Paste this entire file
+ -- 3. Run
+ 
```

+ // OpenAI Integration
+ import OpenAI from &#39;openai&#39;
+ import type { AIMessage } from &#39;./types&#39;
+ 
+ export async function createOpenAIClient(apiKey: string) {
+   if (!apiKey) {
+     throw new Error(&#39;OpenAI API key is required&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   return new OpenAI({
+     apiKey,
+     dangerouslyAllowBrowser: false // Server-side only
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ export async function* chatWithOpenAI(
+   client: OpenAI,
+   messages: AIMessage[],
+   model: string = &#39;gpt-4-turbo-preview&#39;,
+   options?: {
+     temperature?: number
+     maxTokens?: number
+     systemPrompt?: string
+   }
+ ) {
+   const systemPrompt = options?.systemPrompt || &#39;You are a helpful AI coding assistant.&#39;
+   
+   const formattedMessages: OpenAI.ChatCompletionMessageParam[] = [
+     { role: &#39;system&#39;, content: systemPrompt },
+     ...messages.map(msg =&gt; ({
+       role: msg.role as &#39;user&#39; | &#39;assistant&#39;,
+       content: msg.content
+     }))
+   ]
+   
+   const stream = await client.chat.completions.create({
+     model,
+     messages: formattedMessages,
+     temperature: options?.temperature ?? 0.7,
+     max_tokens: options?.maxTokens,
+     stream: true
+   })
+   
+   for await (const chunk of stream) {
+     const content = chunk.choices[0]?.delta?.content
+     if (content) {
+       yield content
+     }
+   }
+ }
+

+ // Anthropic Claude Integration
+ import Anthropic from &#39;@anthropic-ai/sdk&#39;
+ import type { AIMessage } from &#39;./types&#39;
+ 
+ export async function createAnthropicClient(apiKey: string) {
+   if (!apiKey) {
+     throw new Error(&#39;Anthropic API key is required&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   return new Anthropic({
+     apiKey
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ export async function* chatWithClaude(
+   client: Anthropic,
+   messages: AIMessage[],
+   model: string = &#39;claude-3-opus-20240229&#39;,
+   options?: {
+     temperature?: number
+     maxTokens?: number
+     systemPrompt?: string
+   }
+ ) {
+   const systemPrompt = options?.systemPrompt || &#39;You are a helpful AI coding assistant.&#39;
+   
+   // Claude requires system prompt separate from messages
+   const formattedMessages = messages.map(msg =&gt; ({
+     role: msg.role as &#39;user&#39; | &#39;assistant&#39;,
+     content: msg.content
+   }))
+   
+   const stream = await client.messages.create({
+     model,
+     max_tokens: options?.maxTokens ?? 4096,
+     temperature: options?.temperature ?? 0.7,
+     system: systemPrompt,
+     messages: formattedMessages,
+     stream: true
+   })
+   
+   for await (const event of stream) {
+     if (event.type === &#39;content_block_delta&#39; &amp;&amp; event.delta.type === &#39;text_delta&#39;) {
+       yield event.delta.text
+     }
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ export async function chatWithClaudeNonStreaming(
+   client: Anthropic,
+   messages: AIMessage[],
+   model: string = &#39;claude-3-opus-20240229&#39;,
+   options?: {
+     temperature?: number
+     maxTokens?: number
+     systemPrompt?: string
+   }
+ ): Promise&lt;{ content: string; tokens: number }&gt; {
+   const systemPrompt = options?.systemPrompt || &#39;You are a helpful AI coding assistant.&#39;
+   
+   const formattedMessages = messages.map(msg =&gt; ({
+     role: msg.role as &#39;user&#39; | &#39;assistant&#39;,
+     content: msg.content
+   }))
+   
+   const message = await client.messages.create({
+     model,
+     max_tokens: options?.maxTokens ?? 4096,
+     temperature: options?.temperature ?? 0.7,
+     system: systemPrompt,
+     messages: formattedMessages,
+     stream: false
+   })
+   
+   const content = message.content
+     .filter(block =&gt; block.type === &#39;text&#39;)
+     .map(block =&gt; (&#39;text&#39; in block ? block.text : &#39;&#39;))
+     .join(&#39;&#39;)
+   
+   return {
+     content,
+     tokens: message.usage.input_tokens + message.usage.output_tokens
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Available Claude models
+ export const CLAUDE_MODELS = {
+   &#39;claude-3-opus&#39;: &#39;claude-3-opus-20240229&#39;,
+   &#39;claude-3-sonnet&#39;: &#39;claude-3-sonnet-20240229&#39;,
+   &#39;claude-3-haiku&#39;: &#39;claude-3-haiku-20240307&#39;,
+ } as const
+ 
+ export type ClaudeModel = keyof typeof CLAUDE_MODELS
+

+ // Unified AI Interface for Multi-LLM support
+ import { createOpenAIClient, chatWithOpenAI, chatWithOpenAINonStreaming } from &#39;./openai&#39;
+ import { createAnthropicClient, chatWithClaude, chatWithClaudeNonStreaming } from &#39;./anthropic&#39;
+ import type { AIProvider, AIMessage, ChatOptions, ChatResponse } from &#39;./types&#39;
+ 
+ export async function* chat(
+   provider: AIProvider,
+   apiKey: string,
+   messages: AIMessage[],
+   model: string,
+   options?: ChatOptions
+ ): AsyncGenerator&lt;string&gt; {
+   switch (provider) {
+     case &#39;openai&#39;: {
+       const client = await createOpenAIClient(apiKey)
+       yield* chatWithOpenAI(client, messages, model, options)
+       break
+     }
+     case &#39;anthropic&#39;: {
+       const client = await createAnthropicClient(apiKey)
+       yield* chatWithClaude(client, messages, model, options)
+       break
+     }
+     default:
+       throw new Error(&#96;Unsupported provider: ${provider}&#96;)
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ export async function chatNonStreaming(
+   provider: AIProvider,
+   apiKey: string,
+   messages: AIMessage[],
+   model: string,
+   options?: ChatOptions
+ ): Promise&lt;ChatResponse&gt; {
+   let result: { content: string; tokens: number }
+   
+   switch (provider) {
+     case &#39;openai&#39;: {
+       const client = await createOpenAIClient(apiKey)
+       result = await chatWithOpenAINonStreaming(client, messages, model, options)
+       break
+     }
+     case &#39;anthropic&#39;: {
+       const client = await createAnthropicClient(apiKey)
+       result = await chatWithClaudeNonStreaming(client, messages, model, options)
+       break
+     }
+     default:
+       throw new Error(&#96;Unsupported provider: ${provider}&#96;)
+   }
+   
+   return {
+     ...result,
+     model,
+     provider
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Model suggestions based on task type
+ export function suggestModel(taskType: &#39;code&#39; | &#39;chat&#39; | &#39;analysis&#39; | &#39;review&#39;): {
+   provider: AIProvider
+   model: string
+   reason: string
+ } {
+   switch (taskType) {
+     case &#39;code&#39;:
+       return {
+         provider: &#39;openai&#39;,
+         model: &#39;gpt-4-turbo-preview&#39;,
+         reason: &#39;Best for code generation and completion&#39;
+       }
+     case &#39;chat&#39;:
+       return {
+         provider: &#39;anthropic&#39;,
+         model: &#39;claude-3-sonnet-20240229&#39;,
+         reason: &#39;Great balance of speed and quality for conversation&#39;
+       }
+     case &#39;analysis&#39;:
+       return {
+         provider: &#39;anthropic&#39;,
+         model: &#39;claude-3-opus-20240229&#39;,
+         reason: &#39;Superior reasoning for complex analysis&#39;
+       }
+     case &#39;review&#39;:
+       return {
+         provider: &#39;openai&#39;,
+         model: &#39;gpt-4&#39;,
+         reason: &#39;Excellent code review capabilities&#39;
+       }
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Estimate cost per 1K tokens
+ export function estimateCost(provider: AIProvider, model: string): {
+   input: number // $ per 1K tokens
+   output: number // $ per 1K tokens
+ } {
+   // Pricing as of Nov 2024
+   const pricing: Record&lt;AIProvider, Record&lt;string, { input: number; output: number }&gt;&gt; = {
+     openai: {
+       &#39;gpt-4-turbo-preview&#39;: { input: 0.01, output: 0.03 },
+       &#39;gpt-4&#39;: { input: 0.03, output: 0.06 },
+       &#39;gpt-3.5-turbo&#39;: { input: 0.0005, output: 0.0015 }
+     },
+     anthropic: {
+       &#39;claude-3-opus-20240229&#39;: { input: 0.015, output: 0.075 },
+       &#39;claude-3-sonnet-20240229&#39;: { input: 0.003, output: 0.015 },
+       &#39;claude-3-haiku-20240307&#39;: { input: 0.00025, output: 0.00125 }
+     }
+   }
+   
+   return pricing[provider]?.[model] || { input: 0, output: 0 }
+ }
+

+ // API Key Encryption/Decryption
+ // Note: This runs on Edge Functions (server-side only)
+ import CryptoJS from &#39;crypto-js&#39;
+ 
+ const ENCRYPTION_SECRET = process.env.ENCRYPTION_SECRET
+ 
+ if (!ENCRYPTION_SECRET) {
+   console.warn(&#39;ENCRYPTION_SECRET not set. API key encryption disabled.&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ export function encryptApiKey(apiKey: string): string {
+   if (!ENCRYPTION_SECRET) {
+     throw new Error(&#39;Encryption secret not configured&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   return CryptoJS.AES.encrypt(apiKey, ENCRYPTION_SECRET).toString()
+ }
+ 
+ export function decryptApiKey(encryptedKey: string): string {
+   if (!ENCRYPTION_SECRET) {
+     throw new Error(&#39;Encryption secret not configured&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   const bytes = CryptoJS.AES.decrypt(encryptedKey, ENCRYPTION_SECRET)
+   const decrypted = bytes.toString(CryptoJS.enc.Utf8)
+   
+   if (!decrypted) {
+     throw new Error(&#39;Failed to decrypt API key&#39;)
+   }
+   
+   return decrypted
+ }
+ 
+ // Validate API key format
+ export function validateApiKey(provider: &#39;openai&#39; | &#39;anthropic&#39;, apiKey: string): boolean {
+   switch (provider) {
+     case &#39;openai&#39;:
+       return /^sk-[a-zA-Z0-9]{48}$/.test(apiKey)
+     case &#39;anthropic&#39;:
+       return /^sk-ant-[a-zA-Z0-9-]{95}$/.test(apiKey)
+     default:
+       return false
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Mask API key for display (show first 8 and last 4 characters)
+ export function maskApiKey(apiKey: string): string {
+   if (apiKey.length &lt; 12) return &#39;***&#39;
+   return &#96;${apiKey.slice(0, 8)}...${apiKey.slice(-4)}&#96;
+ }
+

+ // Supabase Edge Function: Save encrypted API key
+ import { serve } from &#39;https://deno.land/std@0.168.0/http/server.ts&#39;
+ import { createClient } from &#39;https://esm.sh/@supabase/supabase-js@2&#39;
+ import { encryptApiKey } from &#39;../_shared/encryption.ts&#39;
+ 
+ serve(async (req) =&gt; {
+   // CORS headers
+   if (req.method === &#39;OPTIONS&#39;) {
+     return new Response(null, {
+       headers: {
+         &#39;Access-Control-Allow-Origin&#39;: &#39;*&#39;,
+         &#39;Access-Control-Allow-Headers&#39;: &#39;authorization, x-client-info, apikey, content-type&#39;,
+       },
+     })
+   }
+ 
+   try {
+     // Get Supabase client
+     const supabaseClient = createClient(
+       Deno.env.get(&#39;SUPABASE_URL&#39;) ?? &#39;&#39;,
+       Deno.env.get(&#39;SUPABASE_ANON_KEY&#39;) ?? &#39;&#39;,
+       {
+         global: {
+           headers: { Authorization: req.headers.get(&#39;Authorization&#39;)! },
+         },
+       }
+     )
+ 
+     // Verify user is authenticated
+     const {
+       data: { user },
+       error: authError,
+     } = await supabaseClient.auth.getUser()
+ 
+     if (authError || !user) {
+       return new Response(JSON.stringify({ error: &#39;Unauthorized&#39; }), {
+         status: 401,
+         headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
+       })
+     }
+ 
+     // Parse request body
+     const { provider, apiKey, keyName } = await req.json()
+ 
+     // Validate input
+     if (!provider || !apiKey) {
+       return new Response(
+         JSON.stringify({ error: &#39;Missing provider or apiKey&#39; }),
+         { status: 400, headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; } }
+       )
+     }
+ 
+     if (![&#39;openai&#39;, &#39;anthropic&#39;].includes(provider)) {
+       return new Response(
+         JSON.stringify({ error: &#39;Invalid provider&#39; }),
+         { status: 400, headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; } }
+       )
+     }
+ 
+     // Encrypt API key (server-side only!)
+     const encryptedKey = encryptApiKey(apiKey)
+ 
+     // Save to database
+     const { data, error } = await supabaseClient
+       .from(&#39;user_api_keys&#39;)
+       .upsert({
+         user_id: user.id,
+         provider,
+         encrypted_key: encryptedKey,
+         key_name: keyName || &#96;${provider} API Key&#96;,
+         is_active: true,
+         updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
+       })
+       .select()
+ 
+     if (error) {
+       throw error
+     }
+ 
+     return new Response(
+       JSON.stringify({ success: true, data }),
+       {
+         status: 200,
+         headers: {
+           &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
+           &#39;Access-Control-Allow-Origin&#39;: &#39;*&#39;,
+         },
+       }
+     )
+   } catch (error) {
+     return new Response(
+       JSON.stringify({ error: error.message }),
+       {
+         status: 500,
+         headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
+       }
+     )
+   }
+ })
+

+ // Shared encryption utilities for Edge Functions
+ // Uses Deno&#39;s built-in Web Crypto API
+ 
+ const ENCRYPTION_SECRET = Deno.env.get(&#39;ENCRYPTION_SECRET&#39;)
+ 
+ if (!ENCRYPTION_SECRET) {
+   throw new Error(&#39;ENCRYPTION_SECRET environment variable is required&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ // Convert string to ArrayBuffer
+ function stringToArrayBuffer(str: string): Uint8Array {
+   return new TextEncoder().encode(str)
+ }
+ 
+ // Convert ArrayBuffer to string
+ function arrayBufferToString(buffer: ArrayBuffer): string {
+   return new TextDecoder().decode(buffer)
+ }
+ 
+ // Derive encryption key from secret
+ async function deriveKey(): Promise&lt;CryptoKey&gt; {
+   const keyMaterial = await crypto.subtle.importKey(
+     &#39;raw&#39;,
+     stringToArrayBuffer(ENCRYPTION_SECRET!),
+     { name: &#39;PBKDF2&#39; },
+     false,
+     [&#39;deriveBits&#39;, &#39;deriveKey&#39;]
+   )
+ 
+   return await crypto.subtle.deriveKey(
+     {
+       name: &#39;PBKDF2&#39;,
+       salt: stringToArrayBuffer(&#39;prism-salt&#39;), // In production, use per-key random salt
+       iterations: 100000,
+       hash: &#39;SHA-256&#39;,
+     },
+     keyMaterial,
+     { name: &#39;AES-GCM&#39;, length: 256 },
+     true,
+     [&#39;encrypt&#39;, &#39;decrypt&#39;]
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ export async function encryptApiKey(apiKey: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
+   const key = await deriveKey()
+   const iv = crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint8Array(12))
+   
+   const encrypted = await crypto.subtle.encrypt(
+     { name: &#39;AES-GCM&#39;, iv },
+     key,
+     stringToArrayBuffer(apiKey)
+   )
+ 
+   // Combine IV + encrypted data
+   const combined = new Uint8Array(iv.length + encrypted.byteLength)
+   combined.set(iv, 0)
+   combined.set(new Uint8Array(encrypted), iv.length)
+ 
+   // Convert to base64
+   return btoa(String.fromCharCode(...combined))
+ }
+ 
+ export async function decryptApiKey(encryptedKey: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
+   const key = await deriveKey()
+   
+   // Decode from base64
+   const combined = Uint8Array.from(atob(encryptedKey), c =&gt; c.charCodeAt(0))
+   
+   // Extract IV and encrypted data
+   const iv = combined.slice(0, 12)
+   const encrypted = combined.slice(12)
+ 
+   const decrypted = await crypto.subtle.decrypt(
+     { name: &#39;AES-GCM&#39;, iv },
+     key,
+     encrypted
+   )
+ 
+   return arrayBufferToString(decrypted)
+ }
+ 
+ // Simpler version using crypto-js (alternative, requires npm package in Deno)
+ // For now, use Web Crypto API which is native to Deno
+

+ &#39;use client&#39;
+ 
+ import { useRef, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { Canvas, useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { OrbitControls, PerspectiveCamera, Html } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ 
+ interface Commit {
+   sha: string
+   author: string
+   message: string
+   timestamp: number
+   filesChanged: number
+   insertions: number
+   deletions: number
+ }
+ 
+ interface Scene3DProps {
+   commits: Commit[]
+   onCommitClick?: (commit: Commit) =&gt; void
+   selectedCommitSha?: string
+ }
+ 
+ function CommitNode({ 
+   commit, 
+   position, 
+   isSelected, 
+   onClick 
+ }: { 
+   commit: Commit
+   position: [number, number, number]
+   isSelected: boolean
+   onClick: () =&gt; void
+ }) {
+   const meshRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Mesh&gt;(null)
+   
+   // Pulse animation for selected commit
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (meshRef.current &amp;&amp; isSelected) {
+       meshRef.current.scale.setScalar(1 + Math.sin(state.clock.elapsedTime * 3) * 0.1)
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   // Color based on change size
+   const color = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const total = commit.insertions + commit.deletions
+     if (total &gt; 1000) return &#39;#ff6b6b&#39; // Large change - red
+     if (total &gt; 100) return &#39;#ffd93d&#39; // Medium - yellow
+     return &#39;#6bcf7f&#39; // Small - green
+   }, [commit])
+ 
+   // Size based on files changed
+   const scale = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     return Math.min(0.5 + commit.filesChanged * 0.1, 2)
+   }, [commit])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;mesh
+       ref={meshRef}
+       position={position}
+       onClick={onClick}
+       scale={isSelected ? scale * 1.2 : scale}
+     &gt;
+       &lt;sphereGeometry args={[1, 32, 32]} /&gt;
+       &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+         color={color}
+         emissive={isSelected ? color : &#39;#000000&#39;}
+         emissiveIntensity={isSelected ? 0.5 : 0}
+         metalness={0.5}
+         roughness={0.2}
+       /&gt;
+       &lt;Html distanceFactor={10}&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;px-2 py-1 bg-black/80 text-white text-xs rounded whitespace-nowrap pointer-events-none&quot;&gt;
+           {commit.message.slice(0, 50)}
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/Html&gt;
+     &lt;/mesh&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function CommitEdges({ commits }: { commits: Commit[] }) {
+   const points = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const pts: THREE.Vector3[] = []
+     commits.forEach((commit, i) =&gt; {
+       if (i &gt; 0) {
+         const prevPos = calculatePosition(commits[i - 1], i - 1, commits.length)
+         const currPos = calculatePosition(commit, i, commits.length)
+         pts.push(new THREE.Vector3(...prevPos))
+         pts.push(new THREE.Vector3(...currPos))
+       }
+     })
+     return pts
+   }, [commits])
+ 
+   const lineGeometry = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     const geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry().setFromPoints(points)
+     return geometry
+   }, [points])
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;lineSegments geometry={lineGeometry}&gt;
+       &lt;lineBasicMaterial color=&quot;#667eea&quot; opacity={0.3} transparent /&gt;
+     &lt;/lineSegments&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ function calculatePosition(
+   commit: Commit,
+   index: number,
+   total: number
+ ): [number, number, number] {
+   // Spiral layout
+   const angle = (index / total) * Math.PI * 8
+   const radius = 30 + (index / total) * 20
+   const height = (index / total) * 50
+ 
+   return [
+     Math.cos(angle) * radius,
+     height,
+     Math.sin(angle) * radius
+   ]
+ }
+ 
+ export function Scene3D({ commits, onCommitClick, selectedCommitSha }: Scene3DProps) {
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;w-full h-full&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;Canvas&gt;
+         &lt;PerspectiveCamera makeDefault position={[50, 30, 50]} /&gt;
+         &lt;OrbitControls
+           enableDamping
+           dampingFactor={0.05}
+           minDistance={10}
+           maxDistance={200}
+         /&gt;
+ 
+         {/* Lighting */}
+         &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.4} /&gt;
+         &lt;pointLight position={[10, 10, 10]} intensity={1} /&gt;
+         &lt;pointLight position={[-10, -10, -10]} intensity={0.5} color=&quot;#764ba2&quot; /&gt;
+         
+         {/* Commit nodes */}
+         {commits.map((commit, i) =&gt; (
+           &lt;CommitNode
+             key={commit.sha}
+             commit={commit}
+             position={calculatePosition(commit, i, commits.length)}
+             isSelected={commit.sha === selectedCommitSha}
+             onClick={() =&gt; onCommitClick?.(commit)}
+           /&gt;
+         ))}
+ 
+         {/* Connection lines */}
+         &lt;CommitEdges commits={commits} /&gt;
+ 
+         {/* Grid helper */}
+         &lt;gridHelper args={[100, 100, &#39;#ffffff&#39;, &#39;#333333&#39;]} /&gt;
+ 
+         {/* Axes helper */}
+         &lt;axesHelper args={[50]} /&gt;
+       &lt;/Canvas&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+

+ &#39;use client&#39;
+ 
+ import { useState, useEffect } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ interface TimelineProps {
+   commits: Array&lt;{ sha: string; timestamp: number; message: string }&gt;
+   onSeek: (index: number) =&gt; void
+   currentIndex: number
+ }
+ 
+ export function Timeline({ commits, onSeek, currentIndex }: TimelineProps) {
+   const [isPlaying, setIsPlaying] = useState(false)
+   const [playbackSpeed, setPlaybackSpeed] = useState(100) // ms per commit
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (!isPlaying) return
+ 
+     const interval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
+       onSeek(Math.min(currentIndex + 1, commits.length - 1))
+       
+       if (currentIndex &gt;= commits.length - 1) {
+         setIsPlaying(false)
+       }
+     }, playbackSpeed)
+ 
+     return () =&gt; clearInterval(interval)
+   }, [isPlaying, currentIndex, commits.length, playbackSpeed])
+ 
+   const handlePlayPause = () =&gt; {
+     if (currentIndex &gt;= commits.length - 1) {
+       onSeek(0) // Reset to start
+     }
+     setIsPlaying(!isPlaying)
+   }
+ 
+   const currentCommit = commits[currentIndex]
+   const progress = (currentIndex / Math.max(commits.length - 1, 1)) * 100
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;w-full p-4 bg-gray-800/50 backdrop-blur-lg rounded-xl border border-gray-700&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;flex items-center gap-4 mb-4&quot;&gt;
+         {/* Play/Pause */}
+         &lt;button
+           onClick={handlePlayPause}
+           className=&quot;p-3 bg-purple-500 hover:bg-purple-600 rounded-lg transition&quot;
+         &gt;
+           {isPlaying ? (

+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ 
+ // Prism MCP Server for Claude Code Integration
+ import { Server } from &#39;@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/server/index.js&#39;
+ import { StdioServerTransport } from &#39;@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/server/stdio.js&#39;
+ import {
+   CallToolRequestSchema,
+   ListToolsRequestSchema,
+ } from &#39;@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/types.js&#39;
+ import { createClient } from &#39;@supabase/supabase-js&#39;
+ import simpleGit from &#39;simple-git&#39;
+ 
+ const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.PRISM_SUPABASE_URL || &#39;&#39;
+ const SUPABASE_KEY = process.env.PRISM_SUPABASE_KEY || &#39;&#39;
+ const API_BASE_URL = process.env.PRISM_API_URL || &#39;https://prism.dev&#39;
+ 
+ const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_KEY)
+ 
+ // Initialize MCP Server
+ const server = new Server(
+   {
+     name: &#39;prism-mcp-server&#39;,
+     version: &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
+   },
+   {
+     capabilities: {
+       tools: {},
+     },
+   }
+ )
+ 
+ // Tool: Visualize Repository
+ async function visualizeRepository(repoPath: string) {
+   try {
+     const git = simpleGit(repoPath)
+     
+     // Get repo info
+     const log = await git.log({ maxCount: 1000 })
+     const status = await git.status()
+     const branches = await git.branch()
+     
+     // Create visualization via Supabase
+     const { data, error } = await supabase
+       .from(&#39;repositories&#39;)
+       .insert({
+         repo_url: repoPath,
+         repo_name: repoPath.split(&#39;/&#39;).pop() || &#39;Unknown&#39;,
+         total_commits: log.total,
+       })
+       .select()
+       .single()
+ 
+     if (error) throw error
+ 
+     const shareUrl = &#96;${API_BASE_URL}/share/${data.id}&#96;
+ 
+     return {
+       success: true,
+       totalCommits: log.total,
+       branches: branches.all.length,
+       currentBranch: branches.current,
+       shareUrl,
+       message: &#96;Created 3D visualization with ${log.total} commits. View at: ${shareUrl}&#96;
+     }
+   } catch (error: any) {
+     return {
+       success: false,
+       error: error.message
+     }
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Tool: Analyze Code Quality
+ async function analyzeCode(code: string, language: string) {
+   // Simple static analysis
+   const lines = code.split(&#39;\n&#39;)
+   const issues: string[] = []
+ 
+   // Basic checks
+   if (lines.length &gt; 500) {
+     issues.push(&#39;File is very long (&gt;500 lines). Consider splitting.&#39;)
+   }
+ 
+   if (code.includes(&#39;console.log&#39;) &amp;&amp; language === &#39;typescript&#39;) {
+     issues.push(&#39;Found console.log statements. Remove before production.&#39;)
+   }
+ 
+   if (code.includes(&#39;any&#39;) &amp;&amp; language === &#39;typescript&#39;) {
+     issues.push(&#39;Usage of &quot;any&quot; type found. Consider using specific types.&#39;)
+   }
+ 
+   if (code.includes(&#39;TODO&#39;) || code.includes(&#39;FIXME&#39;)) {
+     issues.push(&#39;Found TODO/FIXME comments.&#39;)
+   }
+ 
+   const analysis = {
+     totalLines: lines.length,
+     language,
+     issues,
+     complexity: lines.length &gt; 300 ? &#39;High&#39; : lines.length &gt; 100 ? &#39;Medium&#39; : &#39;Low&#39;,
+     suggestions: issues.length === 0 ? [&#39;Code looks good!&#39;] : issues
+   }
+ 
+   return analysis
+ }
+ 
+ // Tool: Get Repository Stats
+ async function getRepoStats(repoPath: string) {
+   try {
+     const git = simpleGit(repoPath)
+     
+     const log = await git.log()
+     const status = await git.status()
+     const branches = await git.branch()
+     const tags = await git.tags()
+ 
+     // Get contributors
+     const contributorsRaw = await git.raw([&#39;shortlog&#39;, &#39;-sn&#39;, &#39;--all&#39;])
+     const contributors = contributorsRaw
+       .split(&#39;\n&#39;)
+       .filter(line =&gt; line.trim())
+       .map(line =&gt; {
+         const [commits, ...nameParts] = line.trim().split(/\s+/)
+         return {
+           name: nameParts.join(&#39; &#39;),
+           commits: parseInt(commits)
+         }
+       })
+ 
+     return {
+       totalCommits: log.total,
+       branches: branches.all.length,
+       tags: tags.all.length,
+       contributors: contributors.length,
+       topContributors: contributors.slice(0, 5),
+       currentBranch: branches.current,
+       isDirty: status.modified.length &gt; 0 || status.not_added.length &gt; 0,
+       modifiedFiles: status.modified.length,
+     }
+   } catch (error: any) {
+     throw new Error(&#96;Failed to get repo stats: ${error.message}&#96;)
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Register tools
+ server.setRequestHandler(ListToolsRequestSchema, async () =&gt; {
+   return {
+     tools: [
+       {
+         name: &#39;visualize_repository&#39;,
+         description: &#39;Create a 3D/4D visualization of a Git repository&#39;,
+         inputSchema: {
+           type: &#39;object&#39;,
+           properties: {
+             repoPath: {
+               type: &#39;string&#39;,
+               description: &#39;Path to the Git repository (local or URL)&#39;,
+             },
+           },
+           required: [&#39;repoPath&#39;],
+         },
+       },
+       {
+         name: &#39;analyze_code&#39;,
+         description: &#39;Perform static analysis on code snippet&#39;,
+         inputSchema: {
+           type: &#39;object&#39;,
+           properties: {
+             code: {
+               type: &#39;string&#39;,
+               description: &#39;Code to analyze&#39;,
+             },
+             language: {
+               type: &#39;string&#39;,
+               description: &#39;Programming language&#39;,
+               enum: [&#39;typescript&#39;, &#39;javascript&#39;, &#39;python&#39;, &#39;rust&#39;, &#39;go&#39;],
+             },
+           },
+           required: [&#39;code&#39;, &#39;language&#39;],
+         },
+       },
+       {
+         name: &#39;get_repo_stats&#39;,
+         description: &#39;Get comprehensive statistics about a Git repository&#39;,
+         inputSchema: {
+           type: &#39;object&#39;,
+           properties: {
+             repoPath: {
+               type: &#39;string&#39;,
+               description: &#39;Path to the Git repository&#39;,
+             },
+           },
+           required: [&#39;repoPath&#39;],
+         },
+       },
+     ],
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ // Handle tool calls
+ server.setRequestHandler(CallToolRequestSchema, async (request) =&gt; {
+   const { name, arguments: args } = request.params
+ 
+   try {
+     switch (name) {
+       case &#39;visualize_repository&#39;: {
+         const result = await visualizeRepository(args.repoPath as string)
+         return {
+           content: [
+             {
+               type: &#39;text&#39;,
+               text: JSON.stringify(result, null, 2),
+             },
+           ],
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       case &#39;analyze_code&#39;: {
+         const result = await analyzeCode(args.code as string, args.language as string)
+         return {
+           content: [
+             {
+               type: &#39;text&#39;,
+               text: &#96;Code Analysis Results:\n\n${JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)}&#96;,
+             },
+           ],
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       case &#39;get_repo_stats&#39;: {
+         const result = await getRepoStats(args.repoPath as string)
+         return {
+           content: [
+             {
+               type: &#39;text&#39;,
+               text: &#96;Repository Statistics:\n\n${JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)}&#96;,
+             },
+           ],
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       default:
+         throw new Error(&#96;Unknown tool: ${name}&#96;)
+     }
+   } catch (error: any) {
+     return {
+       content: [
+         {
+           type: &#39;text&#39;,
+           text: &#96;Error: ${error.message}&#96;,
+         },
+       ],
+       isError: true,
+     }
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ // Start server
+ async function main() {
+   const transport = new StdioServerTransport()
+   await server.connect(transport)
+   
+   console.error(&#39;Prism MCP server started&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ main().catch((error) =&gt; {
+   console.error(&#39;Fatal error:&#39;, error)
+   process.exit(1)
+ })
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

+ // Calculate estimated cost
+ export function calculateCost(
+   model: string,
+   inputTokens: number,
+   outputTokens: number
+ ): number {
+   const pricing = MODEL_PRICING[model]
+   if (!pricing) return 0
+   
+   const inputCost = (inputTokens / 1000) * pricing.inputPricePer1K
+   const outputCost = (outputTokens / 1000) * pricing.outputPricePer1K
+   
+   return inputCost + outputCost
+ }
+ 
+ // Get cost comparison for 100K tokens (typical usage)
+ export function getCostComparison() {
+   const testTokens = 100000
+   const results = Object.entries(MODEL_PRICING).map(([key, pricing]) =&gt; ({
+     model: key,
+     displayName: pricing.displayName,
+     cost: calculateCost(key, testTokens / 2, testTokens / 2),
+     provider: pricing.provider
+   }))
+   
+   return results.sort((a, b) =&gt; a.cost - b.cost)
+ }
+ 
+ // Recommend model based on task type and budget
+ export function recommendModel(
+   taskType: &#39;code-generation&#39; | &#39;code-review&#39; | &#39;chat&#39; | &#39;analysis&#39;,

                     &#39;@code-reviewer review this&#39;&quot;)
  webhook            [EXPERIMENTAL] Send webhook notifications to external services (GitHub, Slack,
                     Custom)
  review             [EXPERIMENTAL] Quick review with code-reviewer agent
  audit              [EXPERIMENTAL] Quick audit with sec-audit agent
  test               [EXPERIMENTAL] Quick test generation with test-gen agent
  agent              [EXPERIMENTAL] Natural language agent invocation (e.g., &quot;codex agent &#39;Review
                     with security focus&#39;&quot;)
  lock               [EXPERIMENTAL] Manage repository locks
  features           Inspect feature flags
  help               Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

Arguments:
  [PROMPT]
          Optional user prompt to start the session

Options:
  -c, --config &lt;key=value&gt;
          Override a configuration value that would otherwise be loaded from &#96;~/.codex/config.toml&#96;.
          Use a dotted path (&#96;foo.bar.baz&#96;) to override nested values. The &#96;value&#96; portion is parsed
          as JSON. If it fails to parse as JSON, the raw string is used as a literal.
          
          Examples: - &#96;-c model=&quot;o3&quot;&#96; - &#96;-c &#39;sandbox_permissions=[&quot;disk-full-read-access&quot;]&#39;&#96; - &#96;-c
          shell_environment_policy.inherit=all&#96;

      --enable &lt;FEATURE&gt;
          Enable a feature (repeatable). Equivalent to &#96;-c features.&lt;name&gt;=true&#96;

      --disable &lt;FEATURE&gt;
          Disable a feature (repeatable). Equivalent to &#96;-c features.&lt;name&gt;=false&#96;

  -i, --image &lt;FILE&gt;...
          Optional image(s) to attach to the initial prompt

  -m, --model &lt;MODEL&gt;
          Model the agent should use

      --oss
          Convenience flag to select the local open source model provider. Equivalent to -c
          model_provider=oss; verifies a local Ollama server is running

  -p, --profile &lt;CONFIG_PROFILE&gt;
          Configuration profile from config.toml to specify default options

  -s, --sandbox &lt;SANDBOX_MODE&gt;
          Select the sandbox policy to use when executing model-generated shell commands
          
          [possible values: read-only, workspace-write, danger-full-access]

  -a, --ask-for-approval &lt;APPROVAL_POLICY&gt;
          Configure when the model requires human approval before executing a command

          Possible values:
          - untrusted:  Only run &quot;trusted&quot; commands (e.g. ls, cat, sed) without asking for user
            approval. Will escalate to the user if the model proposes a command that is not in the
            &quot;trusted&quot; set
          - on-failure: Run all commands without asking for user approval. Only asks for approval if
            a command fails to execute, in which case it will escalate to the user to ask for
            un-sandboxed execution
          - on-request: The model decides when to ask the user for approval
          - never:      Never ask for user approval Execution failures are immediately returned to
            the model

      --full-auto
          Convenience alias for low-friction sandboxed automatic execution (-a on-failure, --sandbox
          workspace-write)

      --dangerously-bypass-approvals-and-sandbox
          Skip all confirmation prompts and execute commands without sandboxing. EXTREMELY
          DANGEROUS. Intended solely for running in environments that are externally sandboxed

  -C, --cd &lt;DIR&gt;
          Tell the agent to use the specified directory as its working root

      --search
          Enable web search (off by default). When enabled, the native Responses &#96;web_search&#96; tool
          is available to the model (no perâ€‘call approval)

      --add-dir &lt;DIR&gt;
          Additional directories that should be writable alongside the primary workspace

  -h, --help
          Print help (see a summary with &#39;-h&#39;)

  -V, --version
          Print version

+ # Codex 1.0.0 - Available Commands
+ 
+ **Version**: 1.0.0  
+ **Date**: 2025-11-02
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Interactive Commands
+ 
+ ### Basic Usage
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Interactive TUI
+ codex
+ 
+ # Start with prompt
+ codex &quot;ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯å†…å®¹&quot;
+ 
+ # With image attachment
+ codex -i screenshot.png &quot;ã“ã®ç”»é¢ã‚’å®Ÿè£…ã—ã¦&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Main Commands
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex exec&#96; - Non-interactive execution
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex exec &quot;explain main.rs&quot;
+ codex exec &quot;add logging to all API endpoints&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Aliases**: &#96;codex e&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex resume&#96; - Resume previous session
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Show session picker
+ codex resume
+ 
+ # Resume most recent
+ codex resume --last
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex apply&#96; - Apply latest diff
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Apply Codex&#39;s proposed changes
+ codex apply
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Aliases**: &#96;codex a&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Agent Commands (EXPERIMENTAL)
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex delegate&#96; - Delegate to sub-agent
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Code review
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./src
+ 
+ # Security audit
+ codex delegate sec-audit --scope ./
+ 
+ # Test generation
+ codex delegate test-gen --scope ./tests
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Available Agents**:
+ - &#96;code-reviewer&#96; - Code review with best practices
+ - &#96;sec-audit&#96; - Security vulnerability scanning
+ - &#96;test-gen&#96; - Unit/Integration test generation
+ - &#96;researcher&#96; - Deep research with citations
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex delegate-parallel&#96; - Parallel delegation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Run multiple agents simultaneously
+ codex delegate-parallel code-reviewer,test-gen --scopes ./src,./tests
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex pair&#96; - Pair programming with supervisor
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex pair &quot;Implement JWT authentication&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Natural language orchestration - supervisor analyzes task and assigns to appropriate agents.
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex agent-create&#96; - Create custom agent
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex agent-create &quot;Find all TODO comments and create summary&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex ask&#96; - Ask with @mention
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex ask &quot;@code-reviewer review this file&quot;
+ codex ask &quot;@sec-audit check for vulnerabilities&quot;
+ codex ask &quot;@researcher find best practices for React hooks&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Supported @mentions**:
+ - &#96;@code-reviewer&#96;
+ - &#96;@sec-audit&#96;
+ - &#96;@test-gen&#96;
+ - &#96;@researcher&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex agent&#96; - Natural language agent invocation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex agent &quot;Review with security focus&quot;
+ codex agent &quot;Generate tests for authentication module&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Quick Actions (EXPERIMENTAL)
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex review&#96; - Quick review
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex review ./src/main.rs
+ codex review ./src/
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Equivalent to: &#96;codex delegate code-reviewer --scope &lt;path&gt;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex audit&#96; - Quick audit
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex audit ./
+ codex audit ./src/auth.rs
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Equivalent to: &#96;codex delegate sec-audit --scope &lt;path&gt;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex test&#96; - Quick test generation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex test ./src/auth.rs
+ codex test ./src/api/
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Equivalent to: &#96;codex delegate test-gen --scope &lt;path&gt;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Research Command (EXPERIMENTAL)
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex research&#96; - Deep research
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Quick research
+ codex research &quot;React Server Components best practices&quot;
+ 
+ # Deep dive
+ codex research &quot;Rust async error handling&quot; --depth 3
+ 
+ # Comprehensive strategy
+ codex research &quot;Modern web frameworks&quot; --depth 3 --strategy comprehensive
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Options**:
+ - &#96;--depth &lt;1-5&gt;&#96; - Research depth (default: 2)
+ - &#96;--strategy &lt;focused|comprehensive|exploratory&gt;&#96; - Research strategy (default: focused)
+ 
+ **Features**:
+ - Multi-source research (DuckDuckGo, Brave, Google, Bing)
+ - Cited reports with confidence scores
+ - Contradiction detection
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Utility Commands
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex login&#96; / &#96;codex logout&#96;
+ 
+ Manage authentication credentials.
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex login
+ codex logout
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex mcp&#96; - MCP server management
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Run as MCP server (stdio)
+ codex mcp-server
+ 
+ # Manage MCP servers (experimental)
+ codex mcp &lt;subcommands&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex sandbox&#96; - Sandbox debugging
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex sandbox &lt;command&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Aliases**: &#96;codex debug&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex completion&#96; - Shell completion
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Generate completion script
+ codex completion bash &gt; ~/.codex-completion.bash
+ codex completion zsh &gt; ~/.zsh/completions/_codex
+ codex completion fish &gt; ~/.config/fish/completions/codex.fish
+ codex completion powershell &gt; $PROFILE
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex features&#96; - Feature flags
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex features
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Inspect available feature flags.
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex lock&#96; - Repository locks
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex lock &lt;subcommands&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Manage repository-level locks (experimental).
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex webhook&#96; - Webhook notifications
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex webhook &lt;subcommands&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Send notifications to GitHub, Slack, or custom endpoints (experimental).
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Cloud Commands (EXPERIMENTAL)
+ 
+ ### &#96;codex cloud&#96;
+ 
+ Browse and apply Codex Cloud tasks locally.
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex cloud
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Global Options
+ 
+ ### Model Selection
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Specify model
+ codex -m gpt-5-pro &quot;task&quot;
+ codex -m claude-4.5-sonnet &quot;task&quot;
+ 
+ # Use local OSS model (Ollama)
+ codex --oss &quot;task&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Sandbox &amp; Approval
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Sandbox mode
+ codex -s read-only &quot;task&quot;
+ codex -s workspace-write &quot;task&quot;
+ codex -s danger-full-access &quot;task&quot;  # DANGEROUS!
+ 
+ # Approval policy
+ codex -a untrusted &quot;task&quot;      # Ask for untrusted commands
+ codex -a on-failure &quot;task&quot;     # Ask only on failures
+ codex -a on-request &quot;task&quot;     # Model decides
+ codex -a never &quot;task&quot;          # Never ask (DANGEROUS!)
+ 
+ # Convenience: low-friction auto execution
+ codex --full-auto &quot;task&quot;
+ # Equivalent to: -a on-failure --sandbox workspace-write
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Configuration Override
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Override config.toml values
+ codex -c model=&quot;o3&quot; &quot;task&quot;
+ codex -c &#39;sandbox_permissions=[&quot;disk-full-read-access&quot;]&#39; &quot;task&quot;
+ 
+ # Enable/disable features
+ codex --enable web_search &quot;task&quot;
+ codex --disable telemetry &quot;task&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Working Directory
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Set working directory
+ codex -C /path/to/project &quot;task&quot;
+ 
+ # Add writable directories
+ codex --add-dir /tmp/output &quot;task&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Web Search
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Enable web search
+ codex --search &quot;Find latest React best practices and implement&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Profile
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Use configuration profile
+ codex -p production &quot;deploy&quot;
+ codex -p development &quot;test locally&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## Common Workflows
+ 
+ ### 1. Code Review
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Quick review
+ codex review ./src
+ 
+ # Or detailed
+ codex delegate code-reviewer --scope ./src
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 2. Security Audit
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex audit ./
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 3. Test Generation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ codex test ./src/auth.rs
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 4. Feature Implementation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Simple task
+ codex &quot;Add logging middleware&quot;
+ 
+ # Complex task with orchestration
+ codex pair &quot;Implement JWT authentication with tests and security review&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 5. Research + Implementation
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Step 1: Research
+ codex research &quot;JWT authentication best practices&quot; --depth 3
+ 
+ # Step 2: Implement
+ codex pair &quot;Implement JWT auth based on research findings&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;

+ //! Blueprint Mode CLI commands
+ //!
+ //! Provides command-line interface for creating, managing, and executing blueprints.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use clap::{Parser, Subcommand};
+ use codex_core::blueprint::{
+     BlueprintManager, BlueprintState, ExecutionMode, BlueprintBlock,
+ };
+ use std::path::PathBuf;
+ use tracing::{info, warn};
+ 
+ /// Blueprint Mode commands
+ #[derive(Debug, Parser)]
+ pub struct BlueprintCli {
+     #[clap(subcommand)]
+     pub command: BlueprintCommand,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Subcommand)]
+ pub enum BlueprintCommand {
+     /// Toggle blueprint mode on/off
+     Toggle {
+         /// Enable or disable blueprint mode
+         #[clap(value_parser = parse_bool_flag)]
+         enabled: bool,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Create a new blueprint
+     Create {
+         /// Blueprint title or goal
+         title: String,
+ 
+         /// Execution mode (single, orchestrated, competition)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;orchestrated&quot;)]
+         mode: ExecutionMode,
+ 
+         /// Token budget
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;100000&quot;)]
+         budget_tokens: u64,
+ 
+         /// Time budget in minutes
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;30&quot;)]
+         budget_time: u64,
+     },
+ 
+     /// List all blueprints
+     List {
+         /// Filter by state (drafting, pending, approved, rejected)
+         #[clap(long)]
+         state: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Approve a blueprint
+     Approve {
+         /// Blueprint ID
+         blueprint_id: String,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Reject a blueprint
+     Reject {
+         /// Blueprint ID
+         blueprint_id: String,
+ 
+         /// Rejection reason
+         #[clap(long)]
+         reason: String,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Export a blueprint
+     Export {
+         /// Blueprint ID
+         blueprint_id: String,
+ 
+         /// Export format (md, json, both)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;both&quot;)]
+         format: String,
+ 
+         /// Export path
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;docs/blueprints&quot;)]
+         path: PathBuf,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Get blueprint status
+     Status {
+         /// Blueprint ID
+         blueprint_id: String,
+     },
+ }
+ 
+ /// Parse boolean flag from string (on/off, true/false, yes/no)
+ fn parse_bool_flag(s: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;bool, String&gt; {
+     match s.to_lowercase().as_str() {
+         &quot;on&quot; | &quot;true&quot; | &quot;yes&quot; | &quot;1&quot; =&gt; Ok(true),
+         &quot;off&quot; | &quot;false&quot; | &quot;no&quot; | &quot;0&quot; =&gt; Ok(false),
+         _ =&gt; Err(format!(&quot;Invalid boolean value: {}&quot;, s)),
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Run blueprint CLI command
+ pub async fn run_blueprint_command(cli: BlueprintCli) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let config_dir = codex_core::config::get_config_dir()
+         .context(&quot;Failed to get config directory&quot;)?;
+     let blueprint_dir = config_dir.join(&quot;blueprints&quot;);
+     
+     std::fs::create_dir_all(&amp;blueprint_dir)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to create blueprints directory&quot;)?;
+ 
+     match cli.command {
+         BlueprintCommand::Toggle { enabled } =&gt; {
+             toggle_blueprint_mode(enabled, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::Create {
+             title,
+             mode,
+             budget_tokens,
+             budget_time,
+         } =&gt; {
+             create_blueprint(title, mode, budget_tokens, budget_time, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::List { state } =&gt; {
+             list_blueprints(state, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::Approve { blueprint_id } =&gt; {
+             approve_blueprint(&amp;blueprint_id, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::Reject {
+             blueprint_id,
+             reason,
+         } =&gt; {
+             reject_blueprint(&amp;blueprint_id, &amp;reason, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::Export {
+             blueprint_id,
+             format,
+             path,
+         } =&gt; {
+             export_blueprint(&amp;blueprint_id, &amp;format, &amp;path, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+         BlueprintCommand::Status { blueprint_id } =&gt; {
+             get_blueprint_status(&amp;blueprint_id, &amp;blueprint_dir)?;
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn toggle_blueprint_mode(enabled: bool, blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let state_file = blueprint_dir.join(&quot;mode_state.json&quot;);
+     
+     let state = serde_json::json!({
+         &quot;enabled&quot;: enabled,
+         &quot;timestamp&quot;: chrono::Utc::now().to_rfc3339(),
+     });
+ 
+     std::fs::write(&amp;state_file, serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;state)?)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to write mode state&quot;)?;
+ 
+     if enabled {
+         println!(&quot;âœ… Blueprint Mode: ON&quot;);
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ“‹ All operations are now read-only until blueprints are approved.&quot;);
+     } else {
+         println!(&quot;âœ… Blueprint Mode: OFF&quot;);
+         println!(&quot;ğŸš€ Normal operation resumed.&quot;);
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }

+ fn create_blueprint(
+     title: String,
+     mode: ExecutionMode,
+     budget_tokens: u64,
+     budget_time: u64,
+     blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let now = chrono::Utc::now();
+     let id = format!(&quot;bp-{}-{}&quot;, now.format(&quot;%Y%m%d-%H%M%S&quot;), slug::slugify(&amp;title));
+ 
+     let blueprint = BlueprintBlock {
+         id: id.clone(),
+         title: title.clone(),
+         goal: title.clone(),
+         approach: &quot;To be determined&quot;.to_string(),
+         mode,
+         work_items: vec![],
+         risks: vec![],
+         eval: codex_core::blueprint::EvalCriteria::default(),
+         budget: codex_core::blueprint::Budget {
+             session_cap: Some(budget_tokens),
+             cap_min: Some(budget_time),
+             ..Default::default()
+         },
+         research: vec![],
+         state: BlueprintState::Drafting,
+         created_at: now,
+         updated_at: now,
+         approved_by: None,
+         rejected_reason: None,
+     };
+ 
+     let blueprint_file = blueprint_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, id));
+     std::fs::write(
+         &amp;blueprint_file,
+         serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;blueprint)?,
+     )
+     .context(&quot;Failed to write blueprint&quot;)?;
+ 
+     println!(&quot;âœ… Blueprint created: {}&quot;, id);
+     println!(&quot;ğŸ“‹ Status: {:?}&quot;, blueprint.state);
+     println!(&quot;ğŸ¯ Mode: {}&quot;, mode);
+     println!(&quot;ğŸ’° Budget: {} tokens, {} minutes&quot;, budget_tokens, budget_time);
+     println!();
+     println!(&quot;Next steps:&quot;);
+     println!(&quot;  1. Review: codex blueprint status {}&quot;, id);
+     println!(&quot;  2. Approve: codex blueprint approve {}&quot;, id);
+     println!(&quot;  3. Execute: codex execute {}&quot;, id);

+     Ok(())

+ fn list_blueprints(state_filter: Option&lt;String&gt;, blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let entries = std::fs::read_dir(blueprint_dir)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to read blueprints directory&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let mut blueprints: Vec&lt;BlueprintBlock&gt; = Vec::new();
+ 
+     for entry in entries {
+         let entry = entry?;
+         let path = entry.path();
+ 
+         if path.extension().and_then(|s| s.to_str()) == Some(&quot;json&quot;) {
+             if let Ok(content) = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;path) {
+                 if let Ok(blueprint) = serde_json::from_str::&lt;BlueprintBlock&gt;(&amp;content) {
+                     // Apply state filter if specified
+                     if let Some(ref filter) = state_filter {
+                         let state_str = format!(&quot;{:?}&quot;, blueprint.state).to_lowercase();
+                         if state_str.contains(&amp;filter.to_lowercase()) {
+                             blueprints.push(blueprint);
+                         }
+                     } else {
+                         blueprints.push(blueprint);
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     // Sort by creation date (newest first)
+     blueprints.sort_by(|a, b| b.created_at.cmp(&amp;a.created_at));
+ 
+     if blueprints.is_empty() {
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ“‹ No blueprints found.&quot;);
+         return Ok(());
+     }
+ 
+     println!(&quot;ğŸ“‹ Blueprints ({})&quot;, blueprints.len());
+     println!();
+ 
+     for bp in blueprints {
+         let status_icon = match bp.state {
+             BlueprintState::Drafting =&gt; &quot;ğŸ“&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Pending =&gt; &quot;â³&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Approved =&gt; &quot;âœ…&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Rejected =&gt; &quot;âŒ&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Executing =&gt; &quot;ğŸš€&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Completed =&gt; &quot;ğŸ‰&quot;,
+             BlueprintState::Failed =&gt; &quot;ğŸ’¥&quot;,
+         };
+ 
+         println!(
+             &quot;{} {} | {} | {}&quot;,
+             status_icon,
+             bp.id,
+             format!(&quot;{:?}&quot;, bp.state),
+             bp.title
+         );
+         println!(&quot;   Created: {} | Mode: {}&quot;, bp.created_at.format(&quot;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M&quot;), bp.mode);
+         println!();
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn approve_blueprint(blueprint_id: &amp;str, blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let blueprint_file = blueprint_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, blueprint_id));
+ 
+     if !blueprint_file.exists() {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Blueprint not found: {}&quot;, blueprint_id);
+     }
+ 
+     let content = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;blueprint_file)?;
+     let mut blueprint: BlueprintBlock = serde_json::from_str(&amp;content)?;
+ 
+     blueprint.state = BlueprintState::Approved;
+     blueprint.updated_at = chrono::Utc::now();
+     blueprint.approved_by = Some(&quot;cli-user&quot;.to_string());
+ 
+     std::fs::write(
+         &amp;blueprint_file,
+         serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;blueprint)?,
+     )?;
+ 
+     println!(&quot;âœ… Blueprint {} approved&quot;, blueprint_id);
+     println!(&quot;ğŸš€ Ready for execution&quot;);
+     println!();
+     println!(&quot;Execute with: codex execute {}&quot;, blueprint_id);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn reject_blueprint(blueprint_id: &amp;str, reason: &amp;str, blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let blueprint_file = blueprint_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, blueprint_id));
+ 
+     if !blueprint_file.exists() {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Blueprint not found: {}&quot;, blueprint_id);
+     }
+ 
+     let content = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;blueprint_file)?;
+     let mut blueprint: BlueprintBlock = serde_json::from_str(&amp;content)?;
+ 
+     blueprint.state = BlueprintState::Rejected;
+     blueprint.updated_at = chrono::Utc::now();
+     blueprint.rejected_reason = Some(reason.to_string());
+ 
+     std::fs::write(
+         &amp;blueprint_file,
+         serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;blueprint)?,
+     )?;
+ 
+     println!(&quot;âŒ Blueprint {} rejected&quot;, blueprint_id);
+     println!(&quot;ğŸ“ Reason: {}&quot;, reason);
+     println!();
+     println!(&quot;You can create a new blueprint based on this feedback.&quot;);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }

+ fn export_blueprint(
+     blueprint_id: &amp;str,
+     format: &amp;str,
+     export_path: &amp;PathBuf,
+     blueprint_dir: &amp;PathBuf,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let blueprint_file = blueprint_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, blueprint_id));
+ 
+     if !blueprint_file.exists() {
+         anyhow::bail!(&quot;Blueprint not found: {}&quot;, blueprint_id);
+     }
+ 
+     let content = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;blueprint_file)?;
+     let blueprint: BlueprintBlock = serde_json::from_str(&amp;content)?;
+ 
+     std::fs::create_dir_all(export_path)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to create export directory&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let export_markdown = format == &quot;md&quot; || format == &quot;both&quot;;
+     let export_json = format == &quot;json&quot; || format == &quot;both&quot;;
+ 
+     if export_markdown {
+         let md_path = export_path.join(format!(&quot;{}.md&quot;, blueprint_id));
+         let markdown = generate_markdown(&amp;blueprint);
+         std::fs::write(&amp;md_path, markdown)?;
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ“„ Exported markdown: {}&quot;, md_path.display());
+     }
+ 
+     if export_json {
+         let json_path = export_path.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, blueprint_id));
+         std::fs::write(&amp;json_path, serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;blueprint)?)?;
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ“„ Exported JSON: {}&quot;, json_path.display());
+     }
+ 
+     println!(&quot;âœ… Export complete&quot;);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
