+ //! Git analysis commands for 3D/4D visualization
+ //!
+ //! Provides Git repository analysis capabilities for Kamui4d-style visualization.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use clap::{Parser, Subcommand};
+ use git2::{Repository, Commit, Oid};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ use std::path::PathBuf;
+ 
+ /// Git analysis commands
+ #[derive(Debug, Parser)]
+ pub struct GitAnalyzeCli {
+     #[clap(subcommand)]
+     pub command: GitAnalyzeCommand,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Subcommand)]
+ pub enum GitAnalyzeCommand {
+     /// Analyze commit history with 3D coordinates
+     Commits {
+         /// Repository path (default: current directory)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;.&quot;)]
+         repo_path: PathBuf,
+ 
+         /// Limit number of commits
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;1000&quot;)]
+         limit: usize,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Analyze file change heatmap
+     Heatmap {
+         /// Repository path (default: current directory)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;.&quot;)]
+         repo_path: PathBuf,
+ 
+         /// Limit number of commits to analyze
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;1000&quot;)]
+         limit: usize,
+     },
+ 
+     /// Analyze branch structure
+     Branches {
+         /// Repository path (default: current directory)
+         #[clap(long, default_value = &quot;.&quot;)]
+         repo_path: PathBuf,
+     },
+ }
+ 
+ /// 3D commit representation
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct Commit3D {
+     pub sha: String,
+     pub message: String,
+     pub author: String,
+     pub author_email: String,
+     pub timestamp: String,
+     pub branch: String,
+     pub parents: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub x: f32,
+     pub y: f32,
+     pub z: f32,
+     pub color: String,
+ }
+ 
+ /// File heatmap entry
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct FileHeat {
+     pub path: String,
+     pub change_count: usize,
+     pub additions: usize,
+     pub deletions: usize,
+     pub last_modified: String,
+     pub authors: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub heat_level: f32,
+     pub size: Option&lt;u64&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Branch node for 3D graph
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct BranchNode {
+     pub name: String,
+     pub head_sha: String,
+     pub is_active: bool,
+     pub merge_count: usize,
+     pub created_at: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub last_commit: String,
+     pub x: f32,
+     pub y: f32,
+     pub z: f32,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Run git analysis command
+ pub async fn run_git_analyze_command(cli: GitAnalyzeCli) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     match cli.command {
+         GitAnalyzeCommand::Commits { repo_path, limit } =&gt; {
+             analyze_commits(&amp;repo_path, limit)?;
+         }
+         GitAnalyzeCommand::Heatmap { repo_path, limit } =&gt; {
+             analyze_heatmap(&amp;repo_path, limit)?;
+         }
+         GitAnalyzeCommand::Branches { repo_path } =&gt; {
+             analyze_branches(&amp;repo_path)?;
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn analyze_commits(repo_path: &amp;PathBuf, limit: usize) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let repo = Repository::open(repo_path)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to open Git repository&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let mut revwalk = repo.revwalk()?;
+     revwalk.push_head()?;
+     revwalk.set_sorting(git2::Sort::TIME)?;
+ 
+     let mut commits: Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt; = Vec::new();
+     let mut branch_positions: HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+     let mut depth_map: HashMap&lt;Oid, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+     let mut author_colors: HashMap&lt;String, String&gt; = HashMap::new();
+ 
+     for (i, oid) in revwalk.enumerate() {
+         if i &gt;= limit {
+             break;
+         }
+ 
+         let oid = oid?;
+         let commit = repo.find_commit(oid)?;
+ 
+         let author = commit.author();
+         let author_name = author.name().unwrap_or(&quot;Unknown&quot;).to_string();
+         let author_email = author.email().unwrap_or(&quot;unknown@email&quot;).to_string();
+ 
+         // Generate consistent color for author
+         let color = author_colors
+             .entry(author_email.clone())
+             .or_insert_with(|| generate_author_color(&amp;author_email))
+             .clone();
+ 
+         // Get branch name (simplified - use &quot;main&quot; as default)
+         let branch = get_branch_name(&amp;repo, &amp;commit).unwrap_or_else(|| &quot;main&quot;.to_string());
+ 
+         // Calculate 3D position
+         let x = get_branch_position(&amp;branch, &amp;mut branch_positions);
+         let y = commit.time().seconds() as f32;
+         let z = calculate_depth(&amp;commit, &amp;mut depth_map);
+ 
+         let commit_3d = Commit3D {
+             sha: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+             message: commit.message().unwrap_or(&quot;&quot;).to_string(),
+             author: author_name,
+             author_email,
+             timestamp: chrono::DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+                 .unwrap_or_default()
+                 .to_rfc3339(),
+             branch,
+             parents: commit.parents().map(|p| format!(&quot;{}&quot;, p.id())).collect(),
+             x,
+             y,
+             z,
+             color,
+         };
+ 
+         commits.push(commit_3d);
+     }
+ 
+     // Output as JSON
+     let json = serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;commits)?;
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, json);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn analyze_heatmap(repo_path: &amp;PathBuf, limit: usize) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let repo = Repository::open(repo_path)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to open Git repository&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let mut revwalk = repo.revwalk()?;
+     revwalk.push_head()?;
+     revwalk.set_sorting(git2::Sort::TIME)?;
+ 
+     let mut file_stats: HashMap&lt;String, FileHeatData&gt; = HashMap::new();
+ 
+     for (i, oid) in revwalk.enumerate() {
+         if i &gt;= limit {
+             break;
+         }
+ 
+         let oid = oid?;
+         let commit = repo.find_commit(oid)?;
+ 
+         if commit.parent_count() == 0 {
+             continue;
+         }
+ 
+         let parent = commit.parent(0)?;
+         let diff = repo.diff_tree_to_tree(
+             Some(&amp;parent.tree()?),
+             Some(&amp;commit.tree()?),
+             None,
+         )?;
+ 
+         let author_email = commit.author().email().unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+         let timestamp = chrono::DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+             .unwrap_or_default()
+             .to_rfc3339();
+ 
+         diff.foreach(
+             &amp;mut |delta, _progress| {
+                 if let Some(path) = delta.new_file().path() {
+                     let path_str = path.to_string_lossy().to_string();
+                     let entry = file_stats.entry(path_str).or_insert_with(|| FileHeatData {
+                         change_count: 0,
+                         additions: 0,
+                         deletions: 0,
+                         last_modified: timestamp.clone(),
+                         authors: Vec::new(),
+                     });
+ 
+                     entry.change_count += 1;
+                     entry.last_modified = timestamp.clone();
+                     if !entry.authors.contains(&amp;author_email) {
+                         entry.authors.push(author_email.clone());
+                     }
+                 }
+                 true
+             },
+             None,
+             None,
+             None,
+         )?;
+     }
+ 
+     // Convert to FileHeat with normalized heat levels
+     let max_changes = file_stats.values().map(|s| s.change_count).max().unwrap_or(1);
+     let mut heatmap: Vec&lt;FileHeat&gt; = file_stats
+         .into_iter()
+         .map(|(path, stats)| FileHeat {
+             path: path.clone(),
+             change_count: stats.change_count,
+             additions: stats.additions,
+             deletions: stats.deletions,
+             last_modified: stats.last_modified,
+             authors: stats.authors,
+             heat_level: (stats.change_count as f32) / (max_changes as f32),
+             size: std::fs::metadata(repo_path.join(&amp;path))
+                 .ok()
+                 .map(|m| m.len()),
+         })
+         .collect();
+ 
+     // Sort by heat level (hottest first)
+     heatmap.sort_by(|a, b| b.heat_level.partial_cmp(&amp;a.heat_level).unwrap());
+ 
+     // Output as JSON
+     let json = serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;heatmap)?;
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, json);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ fn analyze_branches(repo_path: &amp;PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     let repo = Repository::open(repo_path)
+         .context(&quot;Failed to open Git repository&quot;)?;
+ 
+     let branches = repo.branches(None)?;
+     let mut branch_nodes: Vec&lt;BranchNode&gt; = Vec::new();
+ 
+     let head = repo.head()?;
+     let active_branch_name = head.shorthand().unwrap_or(&quot;HEAD&quot;);
+ 
+     for (branch, _branch_type) in branches {
+         let branch = branch?;
+         let name = branch.name()?.unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+         let is_active = name == active_branch_name;
+ 
+         if let Some(oid) = branch.get().target() {
+             if let Ok(commit) = repo.find_commit(oid) {
+                 let timestamp = chrono::DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+                     .unwrap_or_default()
+                     .to_rfc3339();
+ 
+                 // Count merge commits (simplified)
+                 let merge_count = count_merge_commits(&amp;repo, &amp;commit, 100)?;
+ 
+                 let branch_node = BranchNode {
+                     name: name.clone(),
+                     head_sha: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+                     is_active,
+                     merge_count,
+                     created_at: None, // Would require walking full history
+                     last_commit: timestamp.clone(),
+                     x: branch_nodes.len() as f32 * 10.0,
+                     y: commit.time().seconds() as f32,
+                     z: 0.0,
+                 };
+ 
+                 branch_nodes.push(branch_node);
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     // Output as JSON
+     let json = serde_json::to_string_pretty(&amp;branch_nodes)?;
+     println!(&quot;{}&quot;, json);
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ // Helper functions
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ struct FileHeatData {
+     change_count: usize,
+     additions: usize,
+     deletions: usize,
+     last_modified: String,
+     authors: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ fn get_branch_name(repo: &amp;Repository, _commit: &amp;Commit) -&gt; Option&lt;String&gt; {
+     // Simplified: return current branch or &quot;main&quot;
+     if let Ok(head) = repo.head() {
+         if let Some(name) = head.shorthand() {
+             return Some(name.to_string());
+         }
+     }
+     None
+ }
+ 
+ fn get_branch_position(branch: &amp;str, positions: &amp;mut HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt;) -&gt; f32 {
+     let len = positions.len();
+     *positions.entry(branch.to_string()).or_insert(len as f32 * 10.0)
+ }
+ 
+ fn calculate_depth(commit: &amp;Commit, depth_map: &amp;mut HashMap&lt;Oid, f32&gt;) -&gt; f32 {
+     let oid = commit.id();
+ 
+     // Check if we&#39;ve already computed this depth
+     if let Some(&amp;depth) = depth_map.get(&amp;oid) {
+         return depth;
+     }
+ 
+     // Root commit has depth 0
+     if commit.parent_count() == 0 {
+         depth_map.insert(oid, 0.0);
+         return 0.0;
+     }
+ 
+     // Compute max parent depth
+     let mut max_parent_depth = 0.0;
+     for parent in commit.parents() {
+         if let Some(&amp;parent_depth) = depth_map.get(&amp;parent.id()) {
+             max_parent_depth = max_parent_depth.max(parent_depth);
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     let depth = max_parent_depth + 1.0;
+     depth_map.insert(oid, depth);
+     depth
+ }
+ 
+ fn generate_author_color(email: &amp;str) -&gt; String {
+     // Hash email to generate consistent hue
+     let hash = email.bytes().fold(0u32, |acc, b| {
+         acc.wrapping_mul(31).wrapping_add(b as u32)
+     });
+     let hue = (hash % 360) as f32;
+     format!(&quot;hsl({}, 70%, 60%)&quot;, hue)
+ }
+ 
+ fn count_merge_commits(repo: &amp;Repository, start_commit: &amp;Commit, limit: usize) -&gt; Result&lt;usize&gt; {
+     let mut count = 0;
+     let mut revwalk = repo.revwalk()?;
+     revwalk.push(start_commit.id())?;
+ 
+     for (i, oid) in revwalk.enumerate() {
+         if i &gt;= limit {
+             break;
+         }
+ 
+         let oid = oid?;
+         if let Ok(commit) = repo.find_commit(oid) {
+             if commit.parent_count() &gt; 1 {
+                 count += 1;
+             }
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     Ok(count)
+ }
+ 
```

+ /**
+  * Blueprint API Client
+  * 
+  * Communicates with Rust CLI via child process execution
+  */
+ 
+ import { exec } from &#39;child_process&#39;
+ import { promisify } from &#39;util&#39;
+ 
+ const execAsync = promisify(exec)
+ 
+ export interface Blueprint {
+   id: string
+   title: string
+   goal: string
+   approach: string
+   mode: &#39;single&#39; | &#39;orchestrated&#39; | &#39;competition&#39;
+   state: &#39;Drafting&#39; | &#39;Pending&#39; | &#39;Approved&#39; | &#39;Rejected&#39; | &#39;Executing&#39; | &#39;Completed&#39; | &#39;Failed&#39;
+   created_at: string
+   updated_at: string
+   approved_by?: string | null
+   rejected_reason?: string | null
+   budget: {
+     session_cap?: number
+     cap_min?: number
+   }
+   work_items: Array&lt;{
+     name: string
+     files_touched: string[]
+     diff_contract: string
+     tests: string[]
+   }&gt;
+   risks: Array&lt;{
+     item: string
+     mitigation: string
+   }&gt;
+ }
+ 
+ export interface CreateBlueprintRequest {
+   title: string
+   mode?: &#39;single&#39; | &#39;orchestrated&#39; | &#39;competition&#39;
+   budget_tokens?: number
+   budget_time?: number
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * List all blueprints
+  */
+ export async function listBlueprints(state?: string): Promise&lt;Blueprint[]&gt; {
+   try {
+     const stateArg = state ? &#96;--state ${state}&#96; : &#39;&#39;
+     const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint list ${stateArg} --json&#96;)
+     return JSON.parse(stdout)
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(&#39;Failed to list blueprints:&#39;, error)
+     return []
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Create a new blueprint
+  */
+ export async function createBlueprint(data: CreateBlueprintRequest): Promise&lt;Blueprint&gt; {
+   const {
+     title,
+     mode = &#39;orchestrated&#39;,
+     budget_tokens = 100000,
+     budget_time = 30,
+   } = data
+ 
+   const { stdout } = await execAsync(
+     &#96;codex blueprint create &quot;${title}&quot; --mode=${mode} --budget-tokens=${budget_tokens} --budget-time=${budget_time} --json&#96;
+   )
+ 
+   return JSON.parse(stdout)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Get blueprint status
+  */
+ export async function getBlueprint(id: string): Promise&lt;Blueprint&gt; {
+   const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint status ${id} --json&#96;)
+   return JSON.parse(stdout)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Approve a blueprint
+  */
+ export async function approveBlueprint(id: string): Promise&lt;Blueprint&gt; {
+   const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint approve ${id} --json&#96;)
+   return JSON.parse(stdout)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Reject a blueprint
+  */
+ export async function rejectBlueprint(id: string, reason: string): Promise&lt;Blueprint&gt; {
+   const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint reject ${id} --reason=&quot;${reason}&quot; --json&#96;)
+   return JSON.parse(stdout)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Export a blueprint
+  */
+ export async function exportBlueprint(
+   id: string,
+   format: &#39;md&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;both&#39; = &#39;both&#39;
+ ): Promise&lt;{ markdown?: string; json?: string }&gt; {
+   const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint export ${id} --format=${format} --json&#96;)
+   return JSON.parse(stdout)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Toggle blueprint mode
+  */
+ export async function toggleBlueprintMode(enabled: boolean): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
+   const flag = enabled ? &#39;on&#39; : &#39;off&#39;
+   await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint toggle ${flag}&#96;)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Get blueprint mode status
+  */
+ export async function getBlueprintModeStatus(): Promise&lt;{ enabled: boolean; timestamp: string }&gt; {
+   try {
+     const { stdout } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint mode-status --json&#96;)
+     return JSON.parse(stdout)
+   } catch (error) {
+     return { enabled: false, timestamp: new Date().toISOString() }
+   }
+ }
+

+ /**
+  * Blueprint Store (Zustand)
+  * 
+  * Global state management for Blueprint Mode
+  */
+ 
+ import { create } from &#39;zustand&#39;
+ import type { Blueprint } from &#39;../api/blueprints&#39;
+ 
+ interface BlueprintStore {
+   // State
+   isEnabled: boolean
+   blueprints: Blueprint[]
+   selectedBlueprint: Blueprint | null
+   loading: boolean
+   error: string | null
+ 
+   // Actions
+   setEnabled: (enabled: boolean) =&gt; void
+   setBlueprints: (blueprints: Blueprint[]) =&gt; void
+   setSelectedBlueprint: (blueprint: Blueprint | null) =&gt; void
+   setLoading: (loading: boolean) =&gt; void
+   setError: (error: string | null) =&gt; void
+   
+   // Computed
+   getDraftingBlueprints: () =&gt; Blueprint[]
+   getPendingBlueprints: () =&gt; Blueprint[]
+   getApprovedBlueprints: () =&gt; Blueprint[]
+   getRejectedBlueprints: () =&gt; Blueprint[]
+ }
+ 
+ export const useBlueprintStore = create&lt;BlueprintStore&gt;((set, get) =&gt; ({
+   // Initial state
+   isEnabled: false,
+   blueprints: [],
+   selectedBlueprint: null,
+   loading: false,
+   error: null,
+ 
+   // Actions
+   setEnabled: (enabled) =&gt; set({ isEnabled: enabled }),
+   
+   setBlueprints: (blueprints) =&gt; set({ blueprints }),
+   
+   setSelectedBlueprint: (blueprint) =&gt; set({ selectedBlueprint: blueprint }),
+   
+   setLoading: (loading) =&gt; set({ loading }),
+   
+   setError: (error) =&gt; set({ error }),
+ 
+   // Computed getters
+   getDraftingBlueprints: () =&gt; 
+     get().blueprints.filter((bp) =&gt; bp.state === &#39;Drafting&#39;),
+   
+   getPendingBlueprints: () =&gt;
+     get().blueprints.filter((bp) =&gt; bp.state === &#39;Pending&#39;),
+   
+   getApprovedBlueprints: () =&gt;
+     get().blueprints.filter((bp) =&gt; bp.state === &#39;Approved&#39;),
+   
+   getRejectedBlueprints: () =&gt;
+     get().blueprints.filter((bp) =&gt; bp.state === &#39;Rejected&#39;),
+ }))
+

+     /// Transition to Executing state
+     pub fn start_execution(self, execution_id: String) -&gt; Result&lt;Self, StateTransitionError&gt; {
+         match self {
+             Self::Approved { .. } =&gt; Ok(Self::Executing {
+                 execution_id,
+                 started_at: Utc::now(),
+             }),
+             _ =&gt; Err(StateTransitionError::InvalidTransition {
+                 from: self.name().to_string(),
+                 to: &quot;executing&quot;.to_string(),
+             }),
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Transition to Completed state
+     pub fn complete_execution(self) -&gt; Result&lt;Self, StateTransitionError&gt; {
+         match self {
+             Self::Executing { execution_id, .. } =&gt; Ok(Self::Completed {
+                 execution_id,
+                 completed_at: Utc::now(),
+             }),
+             _ =&gt; Err(StateTransitionError::InvalidTransition {
+                 from: self.name().to_string(),
+                 to: &quot;completed&quot;.to_string(),
+             }),
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Transition to Failed state
+     pub fn fail_execution(self, error: String) -&gt; Result&lt;Self, StateTransitionError&gt; {
+         match self {
+             Self::Executing { execution_id, .. } =&gt; Ok(Self::Failed {
+                 execution_id,
+                 error,
+                 failed_at: Utc::now(),
+             }),
+             _ =&gt; Err(StateTransitionError::InvalidTransition {
+                 from: self.name().to_string(),
+                 to: &quot;failed&quot;.to_string(),
+             }),
+         }
+     }

+ /**
+  * Blueprint Execution API
+  * 
+  * Server-Sent Events (SSE) endpoint for real-time execution progress
+  */
+ 
+ import { NextRequest } from &#39;next/server&#39;
+ import { exec } from &#39;child_process&#39;
+ import { promisify } from &#39;util&#39;
+ 
+ const execAsync = promisify(exec)
+ 
+ export const runtime = &#39;nodejs&#39;
+ export const dynamic = &#39;force-dynamic&#39;
+ 
+ interface ExecutionEvent {
+   type: &#39;started&#39; | &#39;progress&#39; | &#39;step_completed&#39; | &#39;file_changed&#39; | &#39;completed&#39; | &#39;failed&#39;
+   data: any
+   timestamp: string
+ }
+ 
+ export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
+   const { blueprintId } = await request.json()
+ 
+   if (!blueprintId) {
+     return new Response(JSON.stringify({ error: &#39;Blueprint ID required&#39; }), {
+       status: 400,
+       headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
+     })
+   }
+ 
+   try {
+     // Execute blueprint via CLI
+     const { stdout, stderr } = await execAsync(&#96;codex blueprint execute ${blueprintId}&#96;)
+ 
+     return new Response(
+       JSON.stringify({
+         success: true,
+         output: stdout,
+         error: stderr || null,
+       }),
+       {
+         headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
+       }
+     )
+   } catch (error: any) {
+     return new Response(
+       JSON.stringify({
+         success: false,
+         error: error.message,
+       }),
+       {
+         status: 500,
+         headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
+       }
+     )
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ export async function GET(request: NextRequest) {
+   const searchParams = request.nextUrl.searchParams
+   const blueprintId = searchParams.get(&#39;blueprintId&#39;)
+ 
+   if (!blueprintId) {
+     return new Response(&#39;Blueprint ID required&#39;, { status: 400 })
+   }
+ 
+   // Create Server-Sent Events stream
+   const encoder = new TextEncoder()
+ 
+   const customReadable = new ReadableStream({
+     async start(controller) {
+       // Send initial connection event
+       const connectedEvent: ExecutionEvent = {
+         type: &#39;started&#39;,
+         data: { blueprintId },
+         timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+       }
+       
+       controller.enqueue(encoder.encode(&#96;data: ${JSON.stringify(connectedEvent)}\n\n&#96;))
+ 
+       try {
+         // Simulate execution progress
+         // In production, this would read from execution logs or WebSocket
+         for (let i = 1; i &lt;= 5; i++) {
+           await new Promise((resolve) =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 1000))
+ 
+           const progressEvent: ExecutionEvent = {
+             type: &#39;progress&#39;,
+             data: {
+               current_step: i,
+               total_steps: 5,
+               message: &#96;Executing step ${i}/5&#96;,
+             },
+             timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+           }
+ 
+           controller.enqueue(encoder.encode(&#96;data: ${JSON.stringify(progressEvent)}\n\n&#96;))
+         }
+ 
+         // Send completion event
+         const completedEvent: ExecutionEvent = {
+           type: &#39;completed&#39;,
+           data: {
+             success: true,
+             message: &#39;Blueprint executed successfully&#39;,
+           },
+           timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+         }
+ 
+         controller.enqueue(encoder.encode(&#96;data: ${JSON.stringify(completedEvent)}\n\n&#96;))
+       } catch (error: any) {
+         const failedEvent: ExecutionEvent = {
+           type: &#39;failed&#39;,
+           data: {
+             error: error.message,
+           },
+           timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
+         }
+ 
+         controller.enqueue(encoder.encode(&#96;data: ${JSON.stringify(failedEvent)}\n\n&#96;))
+       } finally {
+         controller.close()
+       }
+     },
+   })
+ 
+   return new Response(customReadable, {
+     headers: {
+       &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;text/event-stream&#39;,
+       &#39;Cache-Control&#39;: &#39;no-cache&#39;,
+       &#39;Connection&#39;: &#39;keep-alive&#39;,
+     },
+   })
+ }
+

+ //! Blueprint execution logging and rollback
+ //!
+ //! Provides execution log persistence and rollback capabilities.
+ 
+ use anyhow::{Context, Result};
+ use chrono::{DateTime, Utc};
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ use std::path::PathBuf;
+ use tracing::{debug, info, warn};
+ 
+ /// File change record
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct FileChange {
+     /// File path
+     pub path: String,
+     
+     /// Change type
+     pub change_type: ChangeType,
+     
+     /// Content before change (for rollback)
+     pub before_content: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Content after change
+     pub after_content: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Timestamp
+     pub timestamp: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Type of file change
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;snake_case&quot;)]
+ pub enum ChangeType {
+     Created,
+     Modified,
+     Deleted,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Execution log for rollback
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ExecutionLog {
+     /// Execution ID
+     pub execution_id: String,
+     
+     /// Blueprint ID
+     pub blueprint_id: String,
+     
+     /// File changes
+     pub file_changes: Vec&lt;FileChange&gt;,
+     
+     /// Git commit hash before execution
+     pub git_commit_before: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Git commit hash after execution
+     pub git_commit_after: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Start time
+     pub started_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     
+     /// End time
+     pub completed_at: Option&lt;DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;&gt;,
+     
+     /// Success flag
+     pub success: bool,
+     
+     /// Error message (if failed)
+     pub error: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     /// Rollback status
+     pub rolled_back: bool,
+     
+     /// Rollback timestamp
+     pub rolled_back_at: Option&lt;DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl ExecutionLog {
+     /// Create a new execution log
+     pub fn new(execution_id: String, blueprint_id: String) -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             execution_id,
+             blueprint_id,
+             file_changes: vec![],
+             git_commit_before: None,
+             git_commit_after: None,
+             started_at: Utc::now(),
+             completed_at: None,
+             success: false,
+             error: None,
+             rolled_back: false,
+             rolled_back_at: None,
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Add file change
+     pub fn add_file_change(&amp;mut self, change: FileChange) {
+         self.file_changes.push(change);
+     }
+     
+     /// Mark as completed
+     pub fn complete(&amp;mut self, success: bool, error: Option&lt;String&gt;) {
+         self.completed_at = Some(Utc::now());
+         self.success = success;
+         self.error = error;
+     }
+     
+     /// Mark as rolled back
+     pub fn mark_rolled_back(&amp;mut self) {
+         self.rolled_back = true;
+         self.rolled_back_at = Some(Utc::now());
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Execution log manager
+ pub struct ExecutionLogManager {
+     /// Log directory
+     log_dir: PathBuf,
+ }
+ 
+ impl ExecutionLogManager {
+     /// Create a new execution log manager
+     pub fn new(log_dir: PathBuf) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         std::fs::create_dir_all(&amp;log_dir)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to create execution log directory&quot;)?;
+         
+         Ok(Self { log_dir })
+     }
+     
+     /// Save execution log
+     pub fn save(&amp;self, log: &amp;ExecutionLog) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let log_file = self.log_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, log.execution_id));
+         
+         let json = serde_json::to_string_pretty(log)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to serialize execution log&quot;)?;
+         
+         std::fs::write(&amp;log_file, json)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to write execution log&quot;)?;
+         
+         info!(&quot;Saved execution log: {}&quot;, log_file.display());
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     /// Load execution log
+     pub fn load(&amp;self, execution_id: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;ExecutionLog&gt; {
+         let log_file = self.log_dir.join(format!(&quot;{}.json&quot;, execution_id));
+         
+         if !log_file.exists() {
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Execution log not found: {}&quot;, execution_id);
+         }
+         
+         let json = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;log_file)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to read execution log&quot;)?;
+         
+         let log: ExecutionLog = serde_json::from_str(&amp;json)
+             .context(&quot;Failed to deserialize execution log&quot;)?;
+         
+         Ok(log)
+     }
+     
+     /// List all execution logs
+     pub fn list(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;ExecutionLog&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut logs = Vec::new();
+         
+         if !self.log_dir.exists() {
+             return Ok(logs);
+         }
+         
+         for entry in std::fs::read_dir(&amp;self.log_dir)? {
+             let entry = entry?;
+             let path = entry.path();
+             
+             if path.extension().and_then(|s| s.to_str()) == Some(&quot;json&quot;) {
+                 if let Ok(json) = std::fs::read_to_string(&amp;path) {
+                     if let Ok(log) = serde_json::from_str::&lt;ExecutionLog&gt;(&amp;json) {
+                         logs.push(log);
+                     }
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Sort by start time (newest first)
+         logs.sort_by(|a, b| b.started_at.cmp(&amp;a.started_at));
+         
+         Ok(logs)
+     }
+     
+     /// Rollback an execution
+     pub fn rollback(&amp;self, execution_id: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         let mut log = self.load(execution_id)?;
+         
+         if log.rolled_back {
+             anyhow::bail!(&quot;Execution {} has already been rolled back&quot;, execution_id);
+         }
+         
+         info!(&quot;Rolling back execution: {}&quot;, execution_id);
+         
+         // Rollback file changes in reverse order
+         for change in log.file_changes.iter().rev() {
+             match self.rollback_file_change(change) {
+                 Ok(_) =&gt; debug!(&quot;Rolled back: {}&quot;, change.path),
+                 Err(e) =&gt; warn!(&quot;Failed to rollback {}: {}&quot;, change.path, e),
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Mark as rolled back
+         log.mark_rolled_back();
+         self.save(&amp;log)?;
+         
+         info!(&quot;Rollback complete for execution: {}&quot;, execution_id);
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     /// Rollback a single file change
+     fn rollback_file_change(&amp;self, change: &amp;FileChange) -&gt; Result&lt;()&gt; {
+         match change.change_type {
+             ChangeType::Created =&gt; {
+                 // Delete the file
+                 if std::path::Path::new(&amp;change.path).exists() {
+                     std::fs::remove_file(&amp;change.path)
+                         .context(&quot;Failed to delete created file&quot;)?;
+                 }
+             }
+             ChangeType::Modified =&gt; {
+                 // Restore original content
+                 if let Some(before_content) = &amp;change.before_content {
+                     std::fs::write(&amp;change.path, before_content)
+                         .context(&quot;Failed to restore modified file&quot;)?;
+                 }
+             }
+             ChangeType::Deleted =&gt; {
+                 // Restore deleted file
+                 if let Some(before_content) = &amp;change.before_content {
+                     std::fs::write(&amp;change.path, before_content)
+                         .context(&quot;Failed to restore deleted file&quot;)?;
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     /// Get execution statistics
+     pub fn get_statistics(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;ExecutionStatistics&gt; {
+         let logs = self.list()?;
+         
+         let total_executions = logs.len();
+         let successful_executions = logs.iter().filter(|l| l.success).count();
+         let failed_executions = logs.iter().filter(|l| !l.success &amp;&amp; l.completed_at.is_some()).count();
+         let rolled_back_executions = logs.iter().filter(|l| l.rolled_back).count();
+         
+         let avg_duration_secs = logs
+             .iter()
+             .filter_map(|l| {
+                 l.completed_at.map(|completed| {
+                     (completed - l.started_at).num_seconds() as f64
+                 })
+             })
+             .sum::&lt;f64&gt;()
+             / total_executions.max(1) as f64;
+         
+         Ok(ExecutionStatistics {
+             total_executions,
+             successful_executions,
+             failed_executions,
+             rolled_back_executions,
+             avg_duration_secs,
+         })
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Execution statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ExecutionStatistics {
+     pub total_executions: usize,
+     pub successful_executions: usize,
+     pub failed_executions: usize,
+     pub rolled_back_executions: usize,
+     pub avg_duration_secs: f64,
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+     
+     #[test]
+     fn test_execution_log_creation() {
+         let log = ExecutionLog::new(&quot;test-exec-1&quot;.to_string(), &quot;bp-1&quot;.to_string());
+         assert_eq!(log.execution_id, &quot;test-exec-1&quot;);
+         assert_eq!(log.blueprint_id, &quot;bp-1&quot;);
+         assert!(!log.rolled_back);
+     }
+     
+     #[test]
+     fn test_file_change_addition() {
+         let mut log = ExecutionLog::new(&quot;test-exec-1&quot;.to_string(), &quot;bp-1&quot;.to_string());
+         
+         log.add_file_change(FileChange {
+             path: &quot;test.rs&quot;.to_string(),
+             change_type: ChangeType::Created,
+             before_content: None,
+             after_content: Some(&quot;fn main() {}&quot;.to_string()),
+             timestamp: Utc::now(),
+         });
+         
+         assert_eq!(log.file_changes.len(), 1);
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

+ //! Blueprint executor tests
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use crate::blueprint::{BlueprintBlock, BlueprintState, ExecutionMode, Budget};
+     use chrono::Utc;
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_blueprint_can_execute() {
+         let mut blueprint = create_test_blueprint();
+         
+         // Should not be executable in Drafting state
+         blueprint.state = BlueprintState::Drafting;
+         assert!(!blueprint.state.can_execute());
+         
+         // Should be executable in Approved state
+         blueprint.state = BlueprintState::Approved {
+             approved_by: &quot;test-user&quot;.to_string(),
+             approved_at: Utc::now(),
+         };
+         assert!(blueprint.state.can_execute());
+     }
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_state_transitions_for_execution() {
+         let state = BlueprintState::Approved {
+             approved_by: &quot;test-user&quot;.to_string(),
+             approved_at: Utc::now(),
+         };
+ 
+         // Approved -&gt; Executing
+         let state = state.start_execution(&quot;exec-1&quot;.to_string()).unwrap();
+         assert!(state.is_executing());
+ 
+         // Executing -&gt; Completed
+         let state = state.complete_execution().unwrap();
+         assert!(state.is_completed());
+         assert!(state.is_terminal());
+     }
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_execution_failure_transition() {
+         let state = BlueprintState::Approved {
+             approved_by: &quot;test-user&quot;.to_string(),
+             approved_at: Utc::now(),
+         };
+ 
+         // Approved -&gt; Executing
+         let state = state.start_execution(&quot;exec-2&quot;.to_string()).unwrap();
+ 
+         // Executing -&gt; Failed
+         let state = state.fail_execution(&quot;Test error&quot;.to_string()).unwrap();
+         assert!(state.is_failed());
+         assert!(state.is_terminal());
+     }
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_invalid_execution_transition() {
+         // Can&#39;t execute from Drafting
+         let state = BlueprintState::Drafting;
+         assert!(state.start_execution(&quot;exec-3&quot;.to_string()).is_err());
+ 
+         // Can&#39;t complete from Approved
+         let state = BlueprintState::Approved {
+             approved_by: &quot;test-user&quot;.to_string(),
+             approved_at: Utc::now(),
+         };
+         assert!(state.complete_execution().is_err());
+     }
+
